There is a door to enter from the side near where the truck was parked. I walked in, verified I was at the right place and got a menu.   After looking over the various hot dog options, all around 8.50 to 9.50 I asked for a recommendation from the lady there and settled on the "Devil Dog". I had an option to try it with different types of sausages and went with the all beef hot dog. One interesting note about this place is that it's a waiter/waitress style dining establishment rather than a typical order at a counter and grab your food when it's ready hot dog joint. This place also seems very bar oriented, but because I both don't drink, and it was around 10:30 AM, I stuck with water to compliment my meal. With the Devil Dog, I was offered a choice of chips or salad. Being a straight male I went with the chips.  I snapped a few pictures of the inside while waiting for my food, and in under five minutes the "Devil Dog" had arrived. It came wrapped in paper with a toothpick with a pickle on it, the chips being off to the side. I dug into the chips first. These were kettle style chips that were hard but tasty. After eating a few I unwrapped the hot dog from it's paper prison. The hot dog was wrapped in a tortilla, it was a long hot dog that was skinless. The Devil Dog had a red peppers, green peppers, cheese, onions and some seasoning that I can't immediately identify. This tasted very Southwestern and was quite good.  Unfortunately, the tortilla wasn't quite up to the task of holding all the peppers and other ingredients on the hot dog as much of it slopped off, I scooped up some of the remaining peppers with chips.  Overall I found this to be an excellent and non-traditional hot dog. It was a bit on the pricey side but was well worth the money. I was both impressed with and enjoyed my trip to Short Leash and would recommend it. I'm going to give this place a full five star review. Thank you Phoenix area Yelpers for recommending this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Devil dog

D3D_D-4cwKSr2sn4uYsrVA.text: To say that I love Short Leash is an understatement. In fact, they will be catering my wedding this November because I want to share the wonderfulness that is Short Leash with all my family and friends.  But enough about me, what you really want to know is why you should eat here:  1) I have never had a dish that I didn't like from Short Leash! It's hard to narrow it down to few favorites, but I definitely recommend the Aiko (add Sriracha if you like spicy), Moki, and Devil Dog. And definitely get the chips for your side. They are homemade and delicious! The fried pickles are also a great choice if you're looking to start with an appetizer.  If you happen to be here for dinner,  get the bacon-wrapped cheddar brats since they only serve it after 5 p.m. and also because it's amazing.  2) Not only are the toppings unique and interesting, but there is enough variety to satisfy everyone in a group. I have vegetarian friends that love Short Leash, and if you happen to have friends who eat gluten free, they can leave happy too.  3) You can definitely taste the freshness of your ingredients, and I love that everything comes from local vendors.  4) The staff at Short Leash are always super nice and welcoming, especially the owners Brad and Kat.   5) Booze! They have a great selection of craft beers and they also have local AZ wines on tap. The truck was great on its own, but now that I can have a beer with my hot dog, it's just that much better.  6) Brunch! You might be wondering how a hot dog could possibly taste good at breakfast. I'm not quiet sure either, but Short Leash has found the secret, and it is damn delicious.  At this point, I don't know why you are still reading this and not at Short Leash!

rF9bSDfMSw1OkQ8tAthPDw.text: I've always loved Short Leash Dogs, so Sit... Stay is just more of a good thing. I have to say that they found a great location for their bricks and mortar restaurant. And the ambience is clean yet eclectic with lots of clever little touches... like the fire hydrants on the outside of the bathroom doors.  The beer selection adds to the already stellar fare (who doesn't like a beer with their hot dog?) and is appropriately focused on craft beer and local breweries.  As for the food, I've raved in the past about their signature dogs served in flatbreads... but now I've found a new favorite.  The beer hot sausage done up as the Bear is amazing.  Imagine smoked gouda, peanut butter, BBQ sauce, bacon and caramel corn all together with a spicy sausage, and you have the makings of a gourmet classic.  I can't seem to order anything else when I visit.   Sidenote: I tried the currywurst and was a bit disappointed. Maybe I'm overly critical having grown up in Germany, but the curry ketchup on this dog (while seemingly house-made) lacks the sweet and spicy punch that defines the True German street food classic.  The corn pups are also a great starter. I like that they seem to include a mixture of the traditional hot dog and Schneider's jalapeno cheese sausage in the corn pups.  It makes each one a little bit of a surprise. If they really want to elevate this dish (even though it's already great), they should consider sourcing the jalapeno cheese brats from Von Hanson's in the East Valley. If you read my review on Von Hanson's, you will find that I have an undying love for this particular sausage.  I'll sit... and I'll stay. As long as I get my fill here on the legit dogs and beer!

Nmkf1LraCSmbDNs5CABB8g.text: The good was delicious, it's a very retro area, small location, mellow atmosphere. They also have a little doughnut bar! It was a little overpriced for a hotdog, but we'll worth it! It's definitely a place to revisit.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2K7cda8JSLJ-UuLwH4T_KA.text: I ordered an iced coffee yesterday and it was horrible!! The coffee was extremely bitter!! I ordered a large. Took two sips and threw it out. I thought their coffee would be amazing since I hear good things about their donuts.  Guess it's back to Starbucks for a large iced coffee at $2.80.   So much for supporting local businesses if they can't make a decent cup of coffee.

2vvwHk3lJgY0TqkKsVCddw.text: A while ago the words "hot dog" and "food truck" would have made me cringe. Combine those words and I'd turn green. Short Leash Dogs has changed my mind and has me wagging my tail.  Short Leash is a food truck that offers gourmet hot dogs, sausages, and brats all from a local vendor - Schreiner's Sausages. They can be found where most food trucks convene around town, but I enjoy them every third Thursday of every month at Whole Foods Raintree. They have 5 regular "combos", a weekly special, and build your own. The build your own is rather daunting, as there are so many toppings. I love that they come on Naan bread instead of hot dog buns. (The Naan bread is super soft, so you know it's fresh.) They also have corn dogs for the kids or young at heart. (They are delish.)   The line can be long, but the actual service is quick and friendly. Also, a long line indicates how good the food is! And let me tell you, it's good! I've had a brat, an Italian sausage, and the "adult" corn dog (jalapenos and cheddar). My friend had the veggie dog and said it was delicious. I would definitely recommend this place and look forward to trying everything on the menu!

daztkWp6vSqzHKisWKBajA.text: The regular cake doughnuts are the best!  They have this crunchy/moist/soft thing going that I have never experienced in a doughnut.  Glad I don't live anywhere near this place, I'd be too tempted.

y2FVCl8QhF5o7tbLCqo37w.text: Another episode of Paul and Lynettes Adventures Around the World!   Such a great place. Great vibes and even better food. I read before we arrived that if you weren't a hotdog fan before, this place will change you...and they were right.   The "bear" and the chili dog were on today's order. We added some insanely amazing fried pickles and jalapeno poppers. Omg it was all so good. Definitely worth a shot. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flooding your brain with goodness while you&#39;re filling your body with deliciousness.
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So many great vibes.
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shirts to remember your experience.

aSTk49vk_D86UUVqC0YEkw.text: This place puts a twist on hot dogs. Instead of using a bun they use naan. The taste and texture goes well with the dog. It also nice because it allows room for all the toppings with out them falling off and making a mess. I got the dog with Fritos. It had good balance and Fritos gave it a nice texture with the spicy dog

YeMUhiF4ugFSSRYsVlqyLw.text: Super tasty joint paired with mega tasty beers. The location is key and right down the street from me.  No parking, which I could care less about being solely a cyclist. I love dining on the patio while watching the city do its thing as the sun sets.  If you're a health nut, this is your cheat day location.  I highly suggest the bbq monstrosity, mouthwatering.  no really my mouth is watering just visualizing that steaming wiener.

nJQ9TZUVOLz7bGyKSbGCjg.text: I can walk there to get doughnuts every weekend. I can stop by in the middle of my shopping trip in Biltmore to get doughnuts.   Creative with ingredients and also tasty, not too sweet not too oily.

B0_kAm9abKIZMGWMz5aHbw.text: We were the only other people in the restaurant and the service was slow and horrible. It took about 25 mins to get a hotdog and fries. It seemed like the coworkers were just sitting around talking. There was only one employee that actually asked us how we were doing about 25 minutes of just sitting there without our food.

0ZKIRP0OhQZS2EsgTiLeOg.text: The donuts are good and large portions, however $23 for a dozen is a little pricey for me. Location is easy to access from Central Avenue. Just wish at least ONE of the breakfast menu items didn't include onions. We don't all want onion breath all day.

fHwUNv7lDya15vcOzC1aPQ.text: Two words people: FRIED PICKLES..   The fried pickles are literally what sent me over the moon.. they were nicely battered, fried to a perfect crisp.. and were juicy, spicy, sweet, and super addicting..  They were my favorite thing about Short Leash...   Now onto their amazing dogs... I ended up getting the March Special, it had cajun potato salad, bacon, and a spicy bratwurst.. soo delicious but definitely not healthy (if that it all even matters!). I honestly cannot remember what other things were in it.. but if you are in line right now trying to decide what to get.. like I was, please go with the fried pickles for $3.00, and try the March Special.. theres a picture of a cute white bichon frise on the food truck window that explains what the March special is, if that helps you out!

1lDBfdU9hP8Yr8XnPELAOA.text: Happened to walk by while down in the art district over the weekend because this place caught my eye, and I say they had Chicago dog ok the menu, me being from Chicago figured, sure why not. First let me say, these are no way even close to what a Chicago dog is. I'm not sure if anyone here actually has had a real Chicago hotdog, because what they are serving certainly isn't it. Almost $20 for my "Chicago dog" and the dog my date got. As another review has written on here, I can't think of anywhere in Chicago that charges that for 2 hotdogs. The only reason they are even getting 2 stars is because the pita bread was great, maybe they can start making gyros, and the beef hotdog was good. Besides that, unless you want to be overcharged for hipster style, so called hotdogs, just keep walking and save your money

glxkB7w2Y2-uvI_87eSakQ.text: This review is for Rollover Doughnuts only. Places an order through uber eats for iced coffee and a cinnamon roll. The iced coffee was half milk, which I cannot drink. There were no specifications online that anything came in the coffee. Also was not given any utensils with my order.  Pretty disappointing.

a3GCrhChdnsH4beyvDEXmA.text: After experiencing the legend that is the Short Leash Dogs food truck, I was excited to try the Sit...Stay Restaurant.  The same popular dogs are available, but the expanded menu is just as good!  On the most recent visit, I had the Fried Green Tomato stack.  As you might guess, it is a stack of fried green tomatoes, with avocados in between each tomato layer and sitting upon a salad of greens, corn, bacon, and possibly some kind of nut.  The whole thing is drizzled with a mayo based dressing.  OH my gosh it was good.  I washed it down with an ice cold coke from a bottle, and supplemented with a couple bites sneaked from my husband's Bear dog on naan.  The atmosphere is active and busy, and a little hipster.  Everyone is super friendly and laid back.  Apparently there's pie next door?  We'll have to try that next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Green Tomato stack

Cw2tmuIy6aFoUs6PQsqyeg.text: Iv'e been here a few times now, sampled a handful of things off the menu and still don't want to come back. The place just isn't for me.   My first experience was a takeout order. My friend ordered the bear and the corndog bites. The bites were delicious! The bear was weird. Peanut butter and hot dog was just too odd of a combo for me. And I should have realized then what I was getting into eating a hotdog on a piece of naan bread.   My second try was on July 4th - hot dog day pretty much. They were out of the pretzel buns - bummer because that eliminated my two top choices. Ordered a build your own with all beef hot dog, ketchup, mustard, mayo, relish. WAY too many condiments and way too much bread. I get they're trying to be original with the naan instead of buns, but the dog was sliding out with every bite, and the condiments were spilling out the back. The dog had good flavor but I stopped eating because it was seriously messy. The beer was great, but it didn't save the night.   Third try. Finally got tot try the pretzel bun with bratwurst and sauerkraut. Huge letdown. Again way too much bread. The pretzel bun was huge and not what I was expecting. The bratwurst was tiny! And dry, and not very flavorful at all. The only flavor I could taste was the kraut. It was such a disappointment. The only upside was the coleslaw. I thought it tasted fresh and light. You could still taste the cabbage, but it also had enough mayo/creaminess to it.   Overall, I will not be back again. I just haven't had anything that would REALLY bring me back. Nothing I can't find at other places - except naan bread, and I think I'll just save that for Indian food. You guys can have Short Leash, I'll just buy all the ingredients from the store and make my own the next time I'm having a hotdog craving.

UPqiH6jdafHFPdJBWGCWYA.text: O my goodness!! I just tried The Bear today (a.k.a. the 7th Inning Stretch) and it was crazy delicious! Where else in the Valley can you get a spicy naan wrap dog smothered with Cracker Jacks, peanut butter, crumbled bacon, smoked gouda cheese and BBQ sauce? I admit that it sounds like a wreck, but I have never had such a tasty dog in my life. Live on the wild side and give it a try, you may never think of hot dog toppings the same way again!

-M6saNBmHpMZJWnn10tDyw.text: "But I don't even LIKE hotdogs!" I proclaimed as I devoured half of my BFs beer hot Oliver style.  That is what I thought until I had my first taste of Short Leash Dogs at the Downtown Phx market a few Sundays ago.  I was shocked at how much I loved it!  The bread!  It's so soft and compliments the dog and toppings perfectly.  The dog, the endless variety of toppings!  So awesome, I can't imagine better street food, and I can't wait to try the one with cream cheese and fried pickles.  In fact, I am planing my next visit as I type this, reminded of how instead of stealing my bfs - I have to have one of my very own ASAP.

J3nMDEnC7l4Ql7aP3SaXtw.text: Please go out of your way to find out where they are located!  You won't regret it.  I have eaten here many times (20+) at Food Truck Friday.  They were part of the food service at World of Beer in Tempe last Saturday.  They had many regulars follow them to WOB and we chatted with many people in the bar who also keep Short Leash on a Short Leash and follow them around town.

E82dO5J2nZDTScSlKpvE4w.text: I love this food truck! The owners are super friendly and the hot dogs are always awesome.

DeTpgAhzvdGJxDq7guaUEQ.text: How have I never reviewed Short Leash? I am so impressed with this food truck. Brad and Kat are always friendly and gracious, even when lines are 40 people long and they're running low on supplies. I've never had anything here that I didn't like. I usually get a chicken dog and it doesn't disappoint! Get anything here. Seriously. You won't regret it!

chKGWqLqPVS9c0VEDfKSaA.text: Had the bear dog, Scotch eggs, and on a separate visit I had the Moki dog, and my wife had the crispy dog breakfast. I have to say, the Moki is my favorite so far. It reminds me of a Sonoran dog like down in Tucson, very tasty. The crispy dog breakfast is also excellent. And I've never had scotch eggs before, but I highly recommend it as an appetizer. Overall great food and friendly service. 5 stars :)

P2WBUPlhjD8WUr1qBSwlvg.text: I am such a fan of this place.  Being from Chicago, I love a Chicago dog any day of the week but what I liked best about Short Leash is the creativity.  You can even chose the type of wiener you're in the mood for...regular, beef, beer hot and brats.  And the flatbread instead of a bun is just the right combination to let you know you're having something special.    Igby is my favorite.  Well, honestly, it's the only one I've had because I like it so much I order it every time.  I'm planning on trying the Moki next and then maybe create my own.  After a couple more Igbys, that is.  Visit them at the Phoenix Public Market on a Saturday morning or Wednesday evening and check out some of the local goodies while you're there.

-g7XQvBYtJL0aDgbYKerrA.text: YUM! If you haven't tracked this Food Truck down, you haven't lived in Phoenix. These guys serve Hot Dogs Right!

8ZXIOcjJuOD6lDrkolKZ1w.text: Still phenomenal, and if you get to the truck at around 11:40am on Fridays the line is not too bad. The Igby is by far the best dog they have available.

qLUayfBkXcIRSTVOXhJlSw.text: Best Hot Dog I have had in Phoenix. I like to think of myself as a Hot Dog Connoisseur and I would give this place a perfect score. We had the food truck version and the service and food was great. We will be coming back for more!

jgqqVYv-mqNOFvjeRBNurw.text: Every time I have come to short leash there is either an issue with the way the food is made or customer service. One time they messed up the order so bad that they offered me a voucher for the next time. I thought this would be a great experience for a family with vegetarians and meat eaters alike. I honestly don't know why I get talked into coming here. The concept is great but the employees are not always on the top of their customer service experience. Smile, offer over the top service and even through mistakes I could work with that.

Rcqc4SbsvzixYK6N5XzjYA.text: Awesome gourmet hotdogs! I get the Bear on a veggie dog. Ingredients sound strange together (peanut butter, bbq sauce, cracker jacks, Gouda... and I add fried pickles), but it tastes like heaven.

82Mw_epqPzm844S9sv6r7g.text: Mmmm...the Aiko with a beer hot! Mango chutney, fresh red onion, tucked into a warm soft flatbread. Best lunch ever at Phoenix Saturday Public Market.

4d04a5Wu5QvIZWrwuHfbrA.text: Love short leash. The best part is they have vegan options with great toppings to choose from. I've been to short leash many times in a variety of places and every time they are extremely nice and consistent with their food. Definitely the best food truck I've tried so far.

214DrFWdjKC7njEY2asqeg.text: Absolutley delicious.  Although the line was long it went pretty fast.  Hot Dog in a flatbread?  Yes!  Especially with a spicy beer dog and crisp bacon!  Best dog I can remember... And it was out of a truck.

0Rbla1qB7PbH9uSXHn6rLw.text: . The best part is they have vegan options with great toppings to choose from.. Definitely the best food truck I've tried so far.

667YdNcS3yU8nuDTbPugNg.text: So happy this food truck establishment now has a brick and mortar restaurant. Grabbed lunch here and will soon be back. This visit I tried to have something I hadn't tried yet so we got the corn dog bites, the oliver and hubby got the moki (which looked great, but too messy to share- or he just liked it too much). I really liked mine and the jalapeno cheese stuffed corn dog bites were my favorite. I almost wish that the app only included these and not the plain hot dog filled bites. Luckily for me I think they know this and I think only 2 out of the 6 were the regular bites. We didn't have a beer this time and I spent quite a bit of time regretting my decision because they had such a stellar selection. Great local and not so local craft beers are available. Must drink next time! Also- I miss the fried pickles and the lady hot dog I tried on a prior taste at the truck, so I will have to visit more often to work my way through the menu! Aw, shucks.

yHzt7-5TG6XVMLKbzlT6Og.text: Man what can i say about short leash dogs other than simply amazing . . . now that i think about it that pretty much sums up short leash. The first time i had their dogs was at my graduation party, my parents said that their hot dogs were absolutely amazing and they weren't wrong.

PeMgPdm0WY0eif0vqbSNSA.text: Our hot dogs were nothing special. I LOVE hot dogs so I always try every place that I can. When we got here the guy asked us if we minded sitting "community style" which is a table that seats 4 and then we sit shoulder-to-shoulder with two other strangers like on the subway. That's totally weird but okay. I got a Moki dog and the dog itself was just a normal boiled-in-water hot dog. They took some barely cooked naan and some shredded cheese and beans and rolled them together and that was what I got for $8. I can make that at my house in a few minutes without much effort. Wife got a pig in a blanket that was a deep fried kielbasa that tasted like it was heavily rolled in sage. We didn't even finish that. Fried pickles were awesome. Our tab was the best joke of the night-$30 for two hot dogs and some fried pickles and a "special" root beer. They ran out of the good kind so he brought me a bottle of IBC and hoped I wouldn't notice the difference.  If you're a hipster looking for a good atmosphere with other androgynous and edgy hipsters then this is your spot. You can wash your hot dog down with a $7 small coffee from Luxe a few blocks away and then go home and wonder where all your money goes. I'm poor and not cool so $30 for two hot dogs and a root beer and fried pickles was not a good value in my opinion. If the food was good then I wouldn't worry about it but the food here is nothing special. If you want a good hot dog go to the new El Guero Canelo in Phoenix or Morenos. They have Sonoran dogs for $2.50 each that taste amazing! Even Portillos will give you a HUGE meal for $30.

r7ZSGz7oS6zuP7lqwZb-MA.text: The best Hot Dogs around bar none! So many different hot dogs to choose from and the toppings are pretty much unlimited. So far the Igby has been my favorite, but next time I so have to add fried pickles to it! Try them out, you will not be disappointed!

2L0Cfx6NhSWXMq-so43xMQ.text: This place was a fun and refreshing alternative to the conventional restaurant for date night. The menu offers creative combinations of toppings and then you pick the style of sausage you want and it's all served on warm naan. At first, I was given the wrong order, but the staff was friendly, quick to apologize and fixed their mistake. The food truck scene allows us to bring the dog and for $20, we had a delicious meal and a change of scenery. Awesome.

P1QQ2GR6iyzx_Bo072l5FQ.text: Love this place! What a cute little laid back spot to have lunch on a Sunday afternoon. My family and I really enjoyed ourselves. I really like how they serve water out of the glass bottles. The fried pickles were delicious as well as the hot dogs. Very fresh food. The prices are a little high but worth every penny.

RMbPJWhf8aQDoNvmnA1gqw.text: This place is fantastic. Physical location + mobile food truck. Great selection of fixings and dogs. Make it just how you like it for a very reasonable price. Will be back soon and often :)  Naandogs ftw.

ysB6CJw23JHW1r--USB22A.text: I stopped eating hot dogs years ago...too scary, too salty, too mysterious.  But all that changed with my first exposure to Short Leash Hot Dogs.  I am not an overboard foodie who likes bleu cheese on a hot dog.  I am a purist.  Call me old-fashioned, call me a traditionalist, but I like my hot dogs BASIC.  Mustard only.  I love that they don't give me a sad look when I order, they just deliver a great dog that fills the length of the superb nan bread.  Perfectly prepared, no mustard drips on my lap!   Childhood is a state of mind and when I take a Short Leash bite, I'm zapped back to ball games with my dad, summer days at the pool, memories of the real thing!   As good as it gets!  Phoenix is so lucky to have them!

GAy5rRPH1o9wCTLzleYJsg.text: This is one of my favorite "restaurants" in Phoenix.  Their food is yummy. If you haven't been adventurous and tried the 7th Inning Stretch Dog- do it. Sounds weird, but it is so good.  I have loved every dog that I have tried.

6hdP3E837_0i9WAuOi_rhA.text: On of my favorite Central Phoenix spots.  Great bear on tap and the menu is fantastic.  The staff is great.

7KY6osP5XgqRPJJOzvMUqg.text: My dad and I were visiting from CA and wanted something unique for dinner so we came to Short Leash after some investigating on Yelp. It was incredible. I got the Chicago dog with a bratwurst and my dad got the Devil dog with a bratwurst and we both agreed that they were the best hot dogs we've ever had. (And we have had many ballpark dogs to compare them to!) We also shared an order of jalapeno poppers but we were too full to finish. They were the best jalapeno poppers I'd ever had and completely different than the traditional method. Instead of feeling like a deep fried chunk of cream cheese they tasted fresh. They slice a jalapeno in half fill it with smoked gouda and put a light batter on top of the cheese. I don't ever want jalapeno poppers a different way. We also saw a customer order the most glorious cinnamon roll and if we had any room left we would have ordered one to go! Check it out!

iL6n3MD2huvdcvuWpDlmlg.text: Awesome food truck! A regular at the Phoenix Public Market on Saturday mornings but I run in to them around downtown frequently and the food is consistently excellent. Great and creative hot dogs. I love the Aiko but don't be afraid to create your own with their vast collection of toppings. I just wish they had a chili dog!

JcUnjbr0_KZnkH-Zpytpzg.text: I love these guys great food, not your everyday hot dog.. Unique topping making it more of a gourmet meal.. Not to mention they are wonderfully nice.. Some of the pictures don't do the dogs justice.

hS1a9UhgNKOliJ5_1NFjlA.text: I really should have gone here before since I am located so close. What a great reat. The name is a bit misleading, but do not let it fool you. The food here is excellant.

q6VUsai8X7xAhxnHl5YBVA.text: Short Leash is quickly becoming one of my favorite lunch spots. The people are kind, the food is wonderful, and the wait is never too long. Their veggie dog is the best I've had in the city (especially when smothered with barbecue sauce and blue cheese). I also appreciate their eclectic beverage assortment. It's such a fresh experience for the cost of a Burger Kind value meal.

GmP3mOFOWfzu61ApBHxTzg.text: They serve good and amazing foods. I like the people who served us, they were so kind and always wearing a smile. One of the greatest San Jose experience.

HznJZ73bBCAIgFu3hgm8_w.text: I pretty much love this place. The hot dogs are great and the options for toppings are unending. It is a little pricey for a hot dog but still worth a stop in. FYI The location at the Biltmore does not have fried pickles (which are amazing) so go to the original location for full options.

xQ2PNOfvWQInfB8WQZgU_g.text: I had the pleasure of trying out Short Leash Dogs at Ignite 10. I had a bratwurst slider. The slider was a bratwurst  served on a pretzel roll with sauerkraut and cheese. That combination was awesome. It was the perfect balance of sweet, savory, and salty.  The sauerkraut was the best I have had since I visited Germany. It was sweet and in combination with the cheese the slider just melted in my mouth. When I think of sliders I think of small portions, but this one was rich and filling. I highly recommend Short Leash Dogs. I can't wait to try their other menu items.

SVBX4GRExQ-Q0F43W7ucNQ.text: This place is great! I love hot dogs and I really liked that this place serves them a little different than I have had before. The icing on the cake for me was the strawberry cheesecake doughnut that they recently started making. WOW.... make sure you save room for that.

94nGp_u6JvMKL3cEj128Qw.text: I came here for food truck friday a few weeks ago. It was delicious! I got to choose all of my toppings for cheap- no $1 extra here or there. I love that their dogs are in the flat bread they use, it's yummy and more efficient than a bun. I'm willing to go out into the phoenix heat for these hot dogs!

_JLm5QEvSTlAL9SrmLytCw.text: The combination of Art and Hot Dogs has been competently accomplished by this man and woman team in a mobile food cart. And they're having fun doing it. And the food is made with love. And the soda selection is perfect. And the price is reasonable. And you shouldn't start a sentence with "And". And Short Leash Dogs makes commuting downtown bearable. And the fried pickles are a real treat. And I'll never wanna eat another hot dog in a bun... gimmie a warm flat bread. And who knew that corn dogs could be so gourmet. And I love Short Leash Dogs!

2tlS_BJPu5mri3ws2iw-ag.text: These are the nicest people you'll ever meet and they sell amazing hot dogs. I especially like the Igby: coleslaw, BBQ sauce and blue cheese. You can order off the list or choose your own combination of toppings, and you can even get a combo named after your dog. Veggie dogs are available for the non-carnivore crowd. A must-try if you're in Phoenix; find them Wednesday evenings and Friday lunchtimes outside the Phoenix Public Market downtown.

XfLwJOkFEOJsp9Y3hDS40g.text: Being six months preggos, and on the search for the perfect hot dog, I took advice from Jan, the owner of Sweet Republic, and tried the corn dogs at Short Leash Dogs.  These dogs did not disappoint.  They were the perfect blend of salty goodness of a local made, non-filler dog balanced with the sweetness of a homemade cornbread batter.  "Gourmet corn dog" sounds like an oxymoron, but Short Leash makes it a reality that works!  Can't wait to try more of their dogs.

rjziNFKs20IAi1o9T2RjJQ.text: The spicy dog was to die for! REALLY yummy and hot without overwhelming the other flavors on my doggy (^_^)

JmDZUHprsaG_SF49op5REA.text: I was really excited to visit Rollover Doughnuts. I love gourmet pastries, and the idea of gourmet doughnuts really hyped me up. When my boyfriend and I got to Rollover for the first time, we were at first very pleased: the building is super cute, the separate "lobby" (study/table room) is well-decorated and clean. But when we got up to the main building to order....  There was a huge swarm of tiny flies in the corner of the pastry case. RIGHT where all of the doughnuts were sitting. A few flies were buzzing around and landing on the doughnuts, but most of them were crawling over one another in the corner. I asked the cashier if there were any doughnuts that hadn't been sitting there all day, and he said with a very bored expression, "Nope, that's all we have." Ummm, no. My boyfriend and I left.  Like I said, I really wanted to like Rollover....but that's absolutely disgusting. Isn't that a health code violation?

TeldoWEeEviQ3EFkgZCErQ.text: I finally got to try the fabled Short Leash hot dog last week when they were parked outside the Convention Center during Comicon. For those that are hot dog traditionalists, this might not be a good hot dog for you, since they wrap the hot dog in a naan-like flatbread, and the selection of condiments for your hot dogs is more unique.   I tried the Aiko, a hot dog with some sweet and spicy flavors. You have your choice of different meats for your hot dog, and I chose the spicy hot. Overall, each component in the meal was good, but it was generally just a little too sweet for my tastes.   Service was fast and friendly.  Oh and they offer veggie dogs too for those that are vegetarians. Very nice!

_LyIo2XislTMfL7IA-u1yQ.text: I walked in 15 minutes before close (which I hate doing), and Evelyn who greeted us treated us like it was the middle of the day! She was so helpful with the menu, extremely kind, and offered us to take as many of their homemade doughnuts to go for free since it was the end of the night.  I ordered the Lady (fried pickles, a creamy sauce, wrapped in a pita-like tortilla). My friend ordered the Bear (peanut butter, cracker jax, bacon, and more).  They were both $14 and AMAZING.  The only thing I would improve is my own fault--we went towards close and didn't get the full experience.  I'll definitely be going again.  The ambiance was great, they had a wide selection of beers, and the food was great!

xvcXJUHkPYMcRomUuFAKJQ.text: Don't be afraid of The Bear, it's delicious.  I only have one bad thing to say about Short Leash: the side salad is crap. It's literally just a bunch of dry lettuce leaves, maybe a little wet from when they were washed. I just put it on my hot dog, because eating it alone was sad. Is it that hard to add a splash of oil and vinegar? I can eat plain lettuce at home.   Other than that, I love this place. Again, don't let The Bear scare you. Do it.

dgCtCiYpnZpfiLvidWVuPQ.text: yummmmm! I think this is my favorite donut shop in Phoenix, and not just because of the adorable location.  We tried an assortment of donuts here, but my favorite by far is the orange pistachio - which I was NOT expecting to like. My foodie toddler loved it as well.   The apple fritter was not quite typical - I think it had some cardamom spice to it; not bad, but not what I expected. The maple and bacon was meh.   I love that they have a cute little lawn and a separate little study building too.

6CUS0yIc8UsYC-wrpaAyYA.text: Outstanding dogs! I had the IGBY (blue cheese, BBQ sauce, coleslaw with an all beef dog. It was a great tasting dog and ample size to fill up the stomach! Their fries were excellent as well. I am headed back again when I get back downtown! Definitely worth a try!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

umx3VybZXmt_U3WqR2a3Bg.text: First off... very blah coffee. But if you're here for the coffee, you're missing the point.  The donuts are amazing. Creative flavors in creative combinations, about as sugary-sweet and fatty as possible, and just delicious.  So grab your coffee somewhere else and then get your butt to Rollover for amazing donuts.

E0uWVHKPfG9m9mSDKISr3Q.text: This is really good place to stop by and get something to eat. Servings are pretty good sized. Loved the cream soda. Music is pretty cool too.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

l18Lzu8fDUoqx5yRoYaWGQ.text: Ordered through postmates and left special instructions for a custom order, maybe it's a  postmates issue on how they transmit the order but it was completely wrong. Called short leash directly and they said to contact postmates, they couldn't do anything. I'm fully aware this is a 1st world issue but still super disappointing.

IKOAZEedLoI_DM0DnFmX3w.text: I loved this place when it was located downtown I went for the first time. Then it moved literally walking distance from my house and I was so excited. I went a couple of times and even took my cousin on her birthday (who is vegan btw) and she enjoyed it. I recently went after being at work all day and they were quite busy which I understand and I patiently waited 20 mins to get a to go order. I asked about what best goes with chicken sausage because I do not eat beef or pork and have not ate a hot dog that was not turkey since 2014. Nonetheless that should not matter I got home got comfortable and got ready to eat and it was a hot dog after me asking for recommendations for chicken sausage ordering a chicken sausage and being there in total about 30 minutes! When I gave them a call I was told by two people on the phone that I have to specify as if I was expecting them to read my mind when I ordered. I considered going back to get my a remake but after the phone call with the rude staff I settled for a refund. Your food may be great but if you don't have great service than what are you here for ? You should try to help and assist your customers and if you make a mistake own up to it apologize and do what you can to make the customer happy. The girl rushed with me the whole time I was there I had to stop her because she didn't add my fries I asked for them I had to ask for a bag then I had to stop her to order a donut. You should treat every customer like they are valued. I was the only woman of African American decent there and it felt as if they did not care to serve me in the same manner as others. This morning I called to confirm my refund and they lady was very rude yet again. I will never be supporting this place again the girl that worked downtown was so nice and I seen her a couple times since I moved now she hasn't been there you guys should take notes on how to treat customers from her. Also how can you have rude employees and an even ruder manager? Please do better !

oJppMLNh1_0eO4wZQKa7Lg.text: I always make my own dog, so this review is not for a particular dog. It's super crowded at this location on weekends so the wait will be a while.  Service is always great, price is reasonable. It's a specialty hot dog restaurant.

8zjzXs6h97jjmLBmIv7Ovg.text: I decided tonight that I was going to be lazy and order from uber eats. I love hotdogs so I decided to give this place a try.   I ordered a Mac and cheese dog, but with no chili, since I'm just not a fan of vegetable chili. The order arrives and I guess someone mixed it up and put online chili on instead of just Mac and cheese. Usually I'll just suck it up and deal with it, but again, not a fan of chili. So I called and a nice woman told me to reorder the order on uber eats and she would take care of the rest.   A few minutes later she called me and said everything was taken care of and that my new order would be sent out.   My food arrived, with an additional donut! Which was awesome. And the Mac and cheese dog was delicious. I'll definitely order from them again. Great food and great customer service.

i6m3SLn98MdgyFA-Iv1QqQ.text: This is a cool spot downtown with a casual hip vibe. Staff are very friendly and helpful. I'm personally not a real hot dog connoisseur but a friend wanted to meet here to talk some business. They do have vegetarian options with a veggie dog or salads which is always a plus since I'm vegetarian by marriage. ;).  Also have the most creative dog options I've ever seen.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is a refreshingly casual spot with a unique menu.

4I7lLauQduMdWSgVATv9CQ.text: It's a down-to-earth hot dog eatery that lets you choose from dozens of toppings. You don't even have to have a plain old dog. Make it vegan. Polish, even. I made mine a brat. Oh, and there's naan (think pita bread, only better) instead of a regular bun.  I ordered the "bear", with a very sweet BBQ sauce, peanut butter, and bacon. Sounds weird enough to work! I enjoyed it, even if the toppings outshone the bratwurst itself, probably because it was small and actually kind of bland.   Toppings usually complement the meal, but an easy criticism here is how toppings BECOME the meal itself. On the other hand, in an age in which everyone wants to innovate staples like pizza and burgers, they insist on limiting hot dogs. You've got Chicago, Sonora, chili or good ol' ball-park-style traditional. That's it. Short Leash changes that.   Also, the house-made chips suck. Half of them were soggy. I won't really hold that against them, though.   Overall, Short Leash is doing what most restaurants don't--take ONE very simple concept, and focus on executing it. It's not perfect, but they've got the best hot dog selection in town, so I can't be too hard on them.

ECCquI-tCMMTXpOAI8BZxA.text: Sad to say I'm super underwhelmed with this one. Ordered corn dogs and the lady hot dog and the actual sausage tasted like a value pack hot dog from the grocery store. They also skimped on toppings and didn't specify that the corn dogs were filled with cheese or that they're extremely small.

t6bWjjxHDoqdkV_lv6B1SA.text: Very impressed with the customer service with this place. I ordered the large fries that came with beans, cheese, chili and the flavors are very bold. The corn dogs were a bit salty though and the waitress was extremely nice and recommended a hot dog that was on the huffington post's must eats before you die. Everything came fairly quickly. Definitely one of the must eats if you are in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ffFYR-kjGd81HU8mfMIYrg.text: Great food, terrible customer service. Felt like I was being treated like a child. I asked my boyfriend if he wanted a beer and before he could ever respond we were hassled for our ID's, almost like the guy didn't think we were old enough. I was just taken aback considering that we hadn't even ordered yet and the guy was so abrupt. The hotdog was out of this world and I loved the setting (and beer was great) the but the guy made me feel so uncomfortable I don't think I'll be back. Bummer.

tC6PoJwu9NM5J-q2VZ2QVQ.text: Stopped in for first Friday- finally! The atmosphere was great and the staff was very friendly. We sat outside and the patio was really nice. I ordered the Oliver with a brat and fries with green chilies. The fries were COLD. So cold in face that the cheese wasn't melted at all. The green chilies were from a can and the fries appeared to be from a freezer bag. Unimpressed.  The presentation of the dog was great but that was it. The "brat" was skinny. The cheese wasn't melted again because as we all know food must be hot to melt the cheese. The menu lead me to believe that there would be a small amount of 1000 Island on the dog and it was drenched. So drenched that it was everywhere.   The server was very attentive and helpful at first but as the end of the meal approached she disappeared. First Friday is busy and I get that so I stood up to help her with a visual cue. I stood for over 20 minutes and I ended up having to find her myself. Luckily, she was kind and offered to buy my drink for me.   The atmosphere and cleanliness and kind staff are great but the food is cold and mediocre at best. You can prepare a better dog at home. Owner please reach out because I expected better from an award winning place and would give it another shot if you respond and give me some answers!

L_D51pfddytlOVXLrHoQ-A.text: I have eaten here a few times and I have discovered this. This place decided to reinvent the wheel. Something as simple as a hotdog, and then you flip it on its ear. At first glance some of the combinations seem intimidating, but you could not be more wrong. Today I had the food I order delivered by a food delivery company and it was worth the extra $5, even if the food had been cold it would still have been amazing.  Last thing I will say and please listen close. Fried pickles!!

Y-Vo4hV3OsgHiQXpqEQfBA.text: The doughnuts are soft and chewy.  The apple fritter is my favorite; sweet with bits of apple and easy to pull apart and eat.  All the flavors of doughnuts I've tried have been very good.

HcIsVPBqSDTROB6qVhBoxA.text: I'm not a huge fan of hot dogs. They usually leave me feeling icky and gassy and no one wants to be around me after I've had one. But when we asked our friend to take us somewhere delicious in Phoenix, she suggested Short Leash, so we threw caution to the wind and went with her.  This is definitely not your typical hot dog place. There are all kinds of flavors to choose from, and you can choose the type of wiener you get. During this visit, I opted for an all beef Bear -- peanut butter, smoked gouda, bacon, BBQ sauce, and Cracker Jack. Yep. Cracker Jack and I also don't have a good relationship, but it sounded like a good day to give things a second chance. When our orders came out, each wiener was wrapped in fluffy naan rather than the traditional hot dog bun. I was absolutely blown away by the flavor combination in the Bear. The sweetness of the BBQ sauce, Cracker Jack, and peanut butter mixed perfectly with the savory gouda and meat. I never knew a hot dog could taste so good.  Seating at this brick and mortar shop is also pretty spacious. Plenty of seats indoors and outdoors.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bear

KB_xLHQpiWI_RkPRBKGTdw.text: Short leash is a Phoenix institution at this point I believe. Their hotdogs are fun and delicious. I was never an adventurous hotdog-er but this place proves my fear wrong everytime I try something new. I usually get the devil dog, because it's a classic. Peppers and chilis with cheese and jalapenos, it is not for people who dont like spice. Skip the fried green tomatoe stack, its bland (but this is a hot dog place- not a cajun restaurant). Definitely dont be afraid of any of the dogs. You wont regret it. Yes chipotle cream cheese on a hot dog is scary..but...YOLO right?

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer menu
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cocktails!
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sharables and things

edZHzC-jIkdCjAzUJl7EqQ.text: This was such a unique find! Such a diverse menu and even a veggie dog! The veggie dog imitates a meat flavor just a heads up for all the vegetarians who aren't looking for that in a substitute! The dogs are so creative and there are so many options. I got the chili Mac n cheese dog and they all come out on a naan type fry bread! It was so delicious and the fried pickles were to die for!! The atmosphere is great as well with indoor and outside seating!! Definitely will be going back!

slHjwa0CHAwtfjKYctfrXw.text: First time to the new location on 7th ave!!! Nice and spacious!! Inside and outdoor seating is available! As always same great food and drinks!!! Service is great and the dogs are even better! So many options and very veggie friendly!! Anyone who's anyone can come here and find something that they will love! Craft beers on tap, nice mixed cocktails,even wine in a can!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried green tomatoes and arugula salad!
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peach tea and bourbon!! My favorite!
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmmmm!!!

rkRZg2yfpRZe-EbVbaFLtA.text: Crispy dogs good, just too much dog. Full big dog. Should use half dog with a stick of cheese, they would be money ahead and have a tastier dog. I know cause I make Crispy Dogs at home that would rival these!! Going to write to them wuth suggestion!! But overall along with their donuts, this place is the Bomb!!

LgAriD04MSEe4Akee0AUuw.text: My sister and I stopped by for a quick before dinner snack.  Their menu is extensive with a million topping choices as well as sausage options.  We ordered the bratwurst stuffed pretzel with a spicy beer hot sausage - $9. The sausage came out encased on a what appeared to be a pretzel boat. It was loaded with sauerkraut, onion, bacon and dressed with swiss + sweet bavarian mustard.   It was a little difficult to eat because it was so enormous, and the sausage to bread ratio was a little off, but other than that, it was good. The spicy beer hot sausage was delicious - hot, and the casing had a nice snap when you bit into it.  My favorite of the night was something call the aiko with a bratwurst - $8. Listed under the signature dog list, it comes enveloped in naan bread and topped with mango chutney + drizzle mayo. This dog made me a naan believer - I don't know what it is with the combination of the bratwurst + naan bread, but it was unlike anything I've ever eaten and it was good.  Short Leash's innovative approach to take an old American favorite into a foray of new flavors won me over. Kudos to them and their sausage game.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. bavarian pretzel dog + aiko + fries
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. aiko with a bratwurst = $8
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. bavarian pretzel dog with a spicy beer hot sausage = $9

UXnawRF86FjNaWMdY9hEKw.text: Stopped at Short Leash this weekend for lunch. I wish I could say it lived up to the rating hype, but I was sadly underwhelmed. We ordered two beers, one fry, a plain hotdog and a Chicago dog. The bill plus tax and tip was well over $40. In my opinion, way too much to pay for a couple of hot dogs. The food was good, but the hotdog casing had a little more snap than I prefer. Overall a good, not great meal especially for the price.

P5gOxZ77hTYY8IJp40vlNg.text: If you haven't tried this place you're missing out. The hotdogs are hugh and so darn good.  The pimento spread excellent,  the Chile fries excellent.  The atmosphere is very welcoming,  staff friendly.   Oh, I almost forgot....they have donuts there they are fresh and not dry.

JKozoVRfWyHkZbKps5ABCw.text: Rollover donuts helped us out with an event and it was wonderful! We are so thankful for their generosity and tasty treats! We can't wait to move closer to the neighborhood so we can stop in more often.

c8lC704W1GMyAC0KAWJ0eA.text: This is one of my favorite spots to go to, day or night. Their food, while some of it takes an adventurous eater, is phenomenal and anything but boring. They have an amazing beer selection, and they also happen to make the best donut I've ever had - Spicy Thai Coconut. On top of that, they have Uno cards at the table, and are always putting on fun/silly events.   The only less than perfect experience I've had at short leash was an understandable mix-up where our dinner service took longer than I would've liked. When I mentioned this to Brad, he immediately took ownership of the situation, made sure amends were made - even though I made it clear I wasn't asking him for anything, and that I, in fact, love Short Leash - and turned what could've been a bummer of a situation into one more reason why I constantly tell people to go try Short Leash.   Thanks for serving awesome food and being awesome people. Please make more Spicy Thai Coconut donuts, so I can get them any time of day. Thanks!

yOpQlCtXd5L_ZXVntA19jA.text: Holy Chicago Dog heaven! No need to visit the windy city to find the perfect dog, we have one right here in our backyard!   We popped into Short Leash on First Friday and it was busy but we were able to find a table for 7 pretty quickly! The service was quick, beer selection in amazing, and the food - well if you are a hot dog eater, you'll be in heaven! They have a variety of different dogs to choose from with extremely unique toppings. I switched out the pita bun for a pretzel bun which I HIGHLY recommend doing. It was so dang soft and tasty! My ONLY complaint was that the toppings were so plentiful, that it was hard to get a bite with everything. The toppings fell off pretty easily! But that is what a fork is for, I suppose!   We will absolutely be back the next time we're craving a hot diggity dog!

9znMCS-kjwdof36ILgbiKw.text: If you are downtown, this place is worth checking out. There are different options when it comes to the hot dog. You can order all beef, chicken, bratwurst, or regular hot dogs. Be adventurous and try something new.   They also have beer, wine, donuts, and coffee.

vx-UPdnvBBGRR7R-EApUpw.text: First time and loved it! The food was great and dog friendly! The employees were very nice and even watched my dog while I ran inside to use the restroom! The orange glaze and pistachio donut was so good! I'll definitely come back!

a5XV42boVbgAM9eLeC77TA.text: I LOVE HOT DOGS!   Hot dogs in a pretzel? Hot dogs in a na'an? What?! Am I in HEAVEN HERE?????   My favorite place to grab a bite, the food is amazing. You can't ever go wrong with anything on their menu.   If I could eat here every single day I would.   The beer selection is great, I love the sides and I am currently working my way down the menu to try every hot dog.

ywAeEdsj2hxv-WDXnWlUag.text: Delish! Cute spot casual atmosphere! They have a really good beer selection-at least 80+assortment of things to try!   Ordered the fried pickles they came with dragon sauce (Sriracha and mayo ) and ranch! Loved that the pickles were sweet and they were crunchy and not soggy! We also ordered the pimento cheese dip that is served with deep fried naan bread ( so good)!   I ordered he pretzel dog (pigs in a blanket on steroids) with a side of Mac and cheese! Large portion I could only eat half! The pretzel was hot and soft and the dog was large and cooked perfect! The Side of cheese is perfect to smear on! Boyfriend got the Bear, woah that was too intense for me but it did come served on the naan bread he said it was a really solid combo! Lastly wanted to say staff there is awesome checked on you cleared plates and helpful.    Small spot but defiantly worth a shot to check it out - we will be back! FYI 2$ cans of beer on Tuesday's!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bear
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel dog with side of Mac and cheese

UclGr3P60gx_jK-cbYN-2Q.text: Decent donuts. I enjoyed the brioche donuts here, but the other cake and yeast varieties were just good. Extra points for unusual flavors, including pistachio. It's a nice space to hang out in too.

i6DtP3Rfy5hL-nrjxfjgKA.text: Place was too effing cute and the fact they are so fur friendly really warmed my heart. I had a pretzel polish dog and it was amazing. Served on trays that looked like dog trays which was such a cute touch !

cWLfB14YwYL3bR38d9WZ7Q.text: A nice and cosy place where you can have delicious and original hot dogs, awesome beers and a good play of UNO. It's really a great place to spend time with friends or family. If I would have still been hungry after my big hot dog, I would definitely tried one of their gorgeous looking doughnuts !
