NZ5lpH88ZlMidAPTW4-KpQ.text: My first time exploring Phoenix and almost walked by this gem. Incredibly friendly and the food was AMAZING! I'd definitely go back and hope others find as do too! A+

9C6IwVc6_puv_2IgKpebcA.text: Looking for something familiar with a twist.. check out this spot you won't be disappointed..  I seem to always pick the same thing when I come here .. the Sunny.. a chicken hotdog with peaches, goat cheese, arugula served on naan. Not your regular hotdog and the flavor combo is delish!   Save room for a donut or sweet treat.. as always I had the bourbon donut.. a brioche donut with chocolate custard .. dusted with powdered sugar.. so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The sunny
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bourbon donut

MGSlJdY_ZYNdUzZh86XG4w.text: Before going to the Phoenix Art Museum, my boyfriend and I decided to stop by to get some hotdogs!   We decided to get the bear and the moki. I was a little scared because of the wacky food combos, but decided to be adventurous and give it a try. While waiting, they had uno cards on the table so we played that until the food was ready. The food came out in a cute little tray. It was pretty hefty and boy was it good. I'm not a big fan of bbq sauce but the sauce mixed with peanut butter is pleasantly good. They offer a variety of unique hotdogs thatll explode your tastebuds! I'll definitely be back to try out their donuts  Their doggy wall of fame is also very cute

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moki and The Bear

JeCYw86cit1D66JbIX7Lmg.text: First timer.   I've always wanted to try this food truck, so the annual Fall Fest at Hance Park provided me the perfect opportunity to do just that.   My friend had told me just how good the hot dogs this truck offers are & he wasn't kidding! He had the Oliver; I had the Igby. We each got an order of 2 Roll Over donuts: Cookie Dough & Chocolate with sprinkles.   I am not a sauerkraut fan at all but my friend is & loved his Oliver. He has ordered that one a few times now since he likes it so much. I really enjoyed the Igby. It has great flavor and with the coleslaw, barbecue sauce, & bleu cheese, the blend of flavors was heavenly!   The Roll Over donuts were okay; a bit sweet for my liking, but good nonetheless.   I will DEFINITELY do Short Leash again! You guys have not seen/heard the last of me or my friend Mark.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Igby!
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Short Leash menu. I laughed at &#34;Pick Your Weiner&#34;!

xHkgWunZzFYZHN5Ghdq1fg.text: Love their donuts! Miss the Roosevelt location! But ordered some donuts thru Grub Hub and they were as awesome as I remembered! My niece and nephew love this place!

hKFx3y2higLL7wFnL-8_dA.text: Our first choice for lunch was closed so we decided to check this place out and we are glad we did! They do breakfast and lunch. Hot dogs are naturally their specialty but they have other menu items including loaded fries which were delicious. Both indoor and outdoor seating available. Portions are quite large- we shared fries and each got a hot dog and were stuffed by the end. It looks like they have an incredible beer list but we stuck to water while we were there. Plenty of parking around the area so you shouldn't have trouble there. It looked like carry out was also very common so if you need to grab something quick or to go you are in luck! Sit outside and people watch!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

foRQBr1RfP4wuk8BcUFnQA.text: I really enjoyed this place! Their hotdogs are served on naan bread rather than the traditional bun which is delicious! I got the Aiko with chicken. It was very good. I definitely want to come back to try other items on their menu and get some drinks that are on their daily specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily specials
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Aiko. Two thumbs up!

4w9eWQgAvOqdeOFY9ixNlQ.text: We had a Pretzel Dog and the Poutine Dog. Each hot dog was about $9, but they were both very, very good. We even stopped at the Donut shop located inside. I have to admit, two hot dogs and two soft drinks for $25 bucks+tip will keep me from coming back in on a regular basis. Other than that, I was happy with the service and the food.

UxfMRlQGdR-KbvRonbZRWQ.text: I have no doubt that Brad and Kat could put just about anything on a hotdog wrap it in the wonderful flatbread and it would be absolutely amazing!  While I usually don't stray far from the Aiko (fresh diced mango, cilantro, onions, jalapenos on a beer hot), I have become quite fond of their Corn Pups (corn dog with spicy jalapeno cheese inside).  Recently tempted to try something new here while reading their Specials board I was drawn in by a hotdog topped with blackeye peas, onions, green chile, old fashioned english cheddar and crumbled Fritos corn chips.  FRITOS...*drool*...  I couldn't decide! Seeing my dilemma, and not being too busy at the moment, they offered to do half of each the Aiko and this daily special.   Needless to say I was yet again BLOWN AWAY with Short Leash's delicious creation. Don't doubt the Masters!  Brad and Kat know their stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinner of Champions

-NJFetNiN2BxCgSZiCRaKw.text: Quite possibly my favorite food truck in Phoenix.  Everything on their menu sounds amazing, so deciding which dog I would like by the time it's my turn to place my order can sometimes be a challenge. But have no worries. Whatever you order will be delicious. When I'm not feeling adventurous to try something new from the menu, I usually order the Moki with a spicy beer hot dog and a side of fried pickles. Yum!

46SlP28_H-6ltkfutUC0Ow.text: Overall solid food. It's not easy to take something as classic as a hot dog, completely reinvent it and make it work. Short leash has done that.   Whether u want spicy, savory, or something completely bananas they have it. I got the bear dog which had peanut butter, BBQ sauce, bacon, gouda and cracker jax. Sounds weird, tastes awesome. Also, the fried pickles are pretty bomb, albeit a little more sweet than sour (if you're really into sour pickles you've been warned). The chips that came with my dog (which I chose over a salad, duh) were the only shitty part. They appeared homemade and we're warm but really needed salt or some kind of flavor, besides dull potato. But who cares, fuck chips!   I'll definitely be back, although I wish the prices were a little lower for a hot dog place (8.50!) Probably create my own dog next time from their endless list of options. Live down the street, two thumbs up.

kIgR3oBW5irx0EkKK3JKKQ.text: Who let the dogs out?! Yes, cheesy.. I get it.. but never in a million years would I say I liked a hot dog joint! They have beef, pork, veggie, and chicken (I think). The latter two is what I can comment on. The veggie is a wee bit bland, but the chicken is quite tasty. I usually get the Devil Dog (spicy goodness) without onions.   I've also had the fried pickles (heavenly) and the fried tomatoes and corn dogs. Do I feel good about myself after I leave here?! Absolutely not, but do I enjoy it going down YAASSS!  Next up: Pies.. I've heard great things.

jmWixiKScEG-HyhRq2YvhA.text: Amazing hot dogs, amazing donuts, and, oh, those wonderful fried pickles. I've tasted most of the menu and everything has been great, if not downright wonderful!

CgFF7RKbgdpJxxxenFutsg.text: I've been dying to try this place ever since I visited their booth at the Devoured Food and Wine Festival. After a busy afternoon, a girlfriend and I decided to go by for lunch today. So glad we did! When we came by the place was empty, and we got immediate service. Our server was very nice and made sure to point out the featured hotdog for the day, which was an Italian sausage with bolognese sauce . We ordered one, as well as the Oliver to share. So good! It was easy enough to split each hotdog for sharing, and we each got the delicious chips. We both also enjoyed the atmosphere and friendly staff. My only complaint was the sangria, which was good, but $8 for a very small glass.   Overall, this was a great place to eat and I can't wait to come back!

CJ_wm1Ae8rtcfv18Q3Czpw.text: ++fried pickles, shepherd's pie special, local beer on tap, patio - - currywurst (the worst)  Things started out well. There were two of us, and we sat on patio. Waitress couldn't remember everything on tap (only a few) but offered to bring a sample of the type of beer I was interested in. We ordered the fried pickles, which were excellent - sweet pickle, savory batter and dipping sauces. The portion was large for two people (I think four could split it and be satisfied).   So many items on the menu sound interesting. I ordered the currywurst.  This was described as knockwurst slow cooked in a tomato & onion curry sauce served in a flatbread bowl with a mixed green side salad. It is basically just as described (except the bread was flat, not in a bowl shape) but it tasted pretty awful. It was like slightly watered down tomato paste with a little onion and sliced hot dog on top of some naan, oh and some curry powder sprinkled on top. The sauce was so thick and plentiful, you could barely see the wurst slices. I ate about half the bread under the sludgy sauce and fished out the wurst. I had to remind the server that brought my dish (not our waitress) that it came with a side salad. It tasted alright, nothing special.  The person I was with went with the featured special - shepherd's pie dog. It came with a side of chips. I tasted it and found it to be what I was thought I would get from this place - an unexpected and impressive twist that completely worked. My dining partner wasn't expecting much from the restaurant but was sold upon biting into this. He was already planning a repeat visit. I wish I had ordered this as well, but, b/c this was our first visit, I wanted to try different things in order to get a feel for what was on offer.   I really hope the currywurst is the only miss on the menu. I wish I had noticed the other yelp reviewer who panned it and ordered something else. I also wonder if anyone does like this or if the cook just didn't do it right (given it didn't look like the photo short leash has of it on a website and that the salad was forgotten).

T0TbrkOnaEe4L-EYs9BnPg.text: That orange glaze w/pistachio donut: AWESOME! And to be honest, I've never liked pistachios. I also tried a couple other flavors that were just as amazing, as well as the coffee. Which was fantastic because it wasn't bitter or burnt tasting like a lot of places. It was mellow but flavorful; you could actually ENJOY the taste.

ytrN5gZQwLv_HoB_gTMnOQ.text: I had no idea a hot dog could be so ridiculously delightful. The bear is outrageous - In a good way. I personally love the mango chutney topping and the spicy dog. It is a True local success story and uses all local ingredients. Great beer selection too.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nom.

aOnp66gtS-nCtbKz_Pagzg.text: Great hot dogs with interesting toppings and even better doughnuts. The quality of the hot dog is bar none and you get Naan bread instead of a bun which works great

QbZkCYknTsODBs0-E58YYw.text: I had lunch here with a friend today during the Art Detour. The place was full but they did something really nice and they would put 2 groups of 2 on a 6-top to get us seated faster. It worked out great. Once we were seated, the service was super slow. I think we waited 15 minutes before someone came to take our order. The food was five stars but the slow service took them down a notch.  I had the breakfast scramble and oh my goodness it was good - eggs, sausage, cheese, peppers, green chilis, and mushrooms on naan. It was delicious.  My friend had the Igby dog - vegetarian - her favorite. She also had a ginger ale and said it was really good.  I'll be back, but probably not when it's so busy.

UWc-9YDDq1UpagW02YjPsQ.text: Checked out this place on National Hotdog Day and im so glad I did. They really were able to execute their ambitious hotdog/sausage menu. Their dished are inventive, creative, and pair well together with the homemade potato chips and craft beer selection. Located in the Phoenix Arts District, you feel at home and comfortable in a great space with artistic surroundings. All in all, it was a good and welcoming experience. Will definitely go back.

TGUYs7fHCz8ygEhz3cCOww.text: Back from Phoenix, and still can't stop thinking of "The Bear"!   Once you get past the novelty of the peanut butter and the crackerjack, the trio of the smoked gouda, bacon, and bbq sauce make an incredible topping!   I had my dog sliced up and with no "bun", so each piece was just smothered in all that lovely mess, where the dog (nitrate free btw!) had enough delicious flavor to stand out as well!  Just heaven!

_Ijm9Rq6nXzYej0Ku1RZjg.text: Had my first Short Leash Dog at the food Truck Friday a few weeks ago and I'm hooked. I had the special, the Mac Daddy- hot dog (I chose the spicy dog) with chili, and MAC AND CHEESE on warm nan bread. DAMN!  I will be frequently their brink and mortar store as soon as they open. So many wieners so little time....  there's a t-shirt in there somewhere :)

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac Daddy-  spicy dog, chili and mac and cheese. I am fairly sure I will dream of this. They should add it to the regular menu.

CV2r-iCwO244Uu7fBzpUYg.text: Amazing as always. Friendly staff and great food! I love the BEAR (aka seventh inning stretch) It may sound strange on paper but with everything together magic happens! Try it! You will not regret it!

TZMKq5y2Du11t_hHNxG3ZA.text: Overrated.  I got one of the "supreme" hotdogs or whatever which was a dollar more ($9.50ish).  It sounded good, brat cooked in beer, covered with saurkraut and bacon.  The brat was as big as a pointer finger and the pretzel bun was slightly larger than a dinner roll.  So picture pig in blanket with much larger roll and a pig that's just a little bigger.  Not proportional, and kind of messy - people get this off a truck and are able to eat it without a fork and knife??  The pita bread with pimento cheese was actually very good, however, the bread was SO greasy.  We were thinking we should go back for this and beer, but realized its probably not a great idea.  Maybe the dogs off the truck are a little bigger?  It would definitely have to be several dollars cheaper for this to work..  The beer selection was pretty good though and value priced.

FuyAgZMX6P9XcX4GgzwVZw.text: The food is DELICIOUS. Very simple, yet unique and the flavors are great!  I have been here 4-5 times and the food is always good, but the service is always VERY iffy.   Many times, being seated has been an ordeal, the service is slow, they haven't had the soda I want, the wait staff is extremely awkward and they seem really anti-social. They are not overly welcoming.  I always come back for the food, but my biggest and most recurring complaint is the service. Considering the food combinations are based off of different hot dogs and sausages, in my opinion it takes a little longer than I think it should, especially with the service itself.   Otherwise, it's a great new, unique place with great food. I have never tried the food truck, but have never heard any complaints about the food.   They also have a good selection of "hipster" drinks, local products and alcohol, if I remember correctly.

aYLKjmKAF_jmVvdUz8fAOQ.text: I got the brat. I've had better brat at outdoor bbqs. The German bun wasn't that good either.  Sauerkraut was decent.  The salad that came with it was good.  Service was excellent. I'll try something else next time

UX71EGi8PRdSuQDRs-QcLg.text: YES, YES, YES!!! My brother and I were in Phoenix for the week (unfortunately our father had a stroke...but is doing much better now) from San Diego. We saw several catering trucks parked at a farmers market on Wed night and popped in.  So glad we did! I had a dog with mango chutney and other yummies.  Serving them on flat bread... Genius!!!! My brother ordered the corn dog.  The breading actually tasted like corn!  The owners couldn't have been more friendly and outgoing.  When they told us of their breakfast dog on Sat mornings....  We happened to still be in town on Sat and it was a given that we'd be going back!  Breakfast was insane!!!!  We took one to go for our family at the hospital.  All in all, utterly fantastic. If I should be in Phoenix again, you can bet I will make it a point to seek out Short Leash!  Thanks again, -John from San Diego

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Dog.  Insane!

sUxN8-yEo67RsjkEpo56yA.text: I hosted my book club there last night because the book was about a dog and I wanted to keep with the theme. Everyone was so friendly and accommodating! Our group had everything from the Bear dogs, Pretzel dogs, Polish dogs, fries, and mac and cheese. They tasted a variety of the beers as well. It was all delicious and the whole group raved about the food, atmosphere, and the staff! Because it was a book club we stayed there longer than a typical dinner and everyone was so gracious and kind about the length of our stay. At the end of the evening we even had the opportunity to taste their donuts and they were delicious too! I appreciate the hospitality and wholeheartedly recommend the short leash!

hx6h-LR67wV8EJWuQse2zg.text: I'm more than willing to sit, stay, rollover, play dead, shake, or whatever trick Short Leash Hot Dogs wants me to do to enjoy one of its wonderful hot dogs. I've loved the truck, so naturally I would love the restaurant. And even better, I can enjoy the food pretty much whenever I want without the lines that always accompany the truck.  Just so you know, there is not a lot space in the restaurant or parking lot. I had to use a meter down the street, but don't worry, meters downtown take credit cards.  Also; If you want a pretty good donut for desert, there is a bakery case with some Rollover Donut selections in the back.

qdl48dYbqpBdwsdAnW1tjA.text: Very disappointed. Cute aesthetics. Glasses for water were dirty. Ordered a Titos with soda water at the bar, bartender wouldn't make it and there were 2 bottles of Titos and a 12 pack soda water behind her. She said I couldn't order it if it wasn't on the menu. Order sweet and spicy meatballs, sauce was bland and the meatballs were microwaved and over cooked on the inside. We won't be going back there again.

5ZnYYsWdwQORTntVwuIyNA.text: Sooooo good.  And how the heck does the owner Brad remember all of our names!?

4oBaYB2XV-csMRjdQRlwDw.text: Sometimes in life you just need a bratwurst stuffed pretzel loaded with sauerkraut, bacon, swiss cheese and some sweet , sweet bavarian mustard to make a lousy day better.. oh and maybe a side of loaded fries and a doughnut to top it off with.  Now this may seem like a bit much for one person to eat, but I promise you, it totally was.  Yet, I could not help myself.        The combination of juicy bratwurst absored into a soft, warm pretzel covered in melted cheese and sauerkraut topped with a sweet yet tart bavarian mustard was too much to handle.  It was everything I had been waiting to eat but it left me wanting more.  After finishing it, I immediately regretted not having ordered another dog, but it was ok, because I had ordered some back up items.      Along with my main, I had an order of the loaded fries which consisted of crispy french fries covered in chilli, cheese, sour cream and japalenos.  The chilli was quite yummy and would have been good even on its own.  I would highly suggest this if you like your fries messy and delicious.  The next victim after the loaded fries was the orange glazed, chopped pistacio covered doughnut.  It was a light, airy, full flavored mess.  The orange glaze was not too sweet where my brain had to shut down due to sugar overload, but it was still upfront enough to let me know, I should only eat one.  The mixture of orange and pistacio was aromatic and very prominent in the taste.  The pistacios themselves gave a great texture, and really added that "wow" factor.        I really cannot find fault in my meal, it was freaking GOOD and I was completely satisified with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pistacio donut.
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bratwurst stuffed pretzel.
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loaded fries.

t9KXJsQpcfsm1GsKghovHQ.text: Hot dogs in pitas to hold all of the toppings. I like their selection. It's a great place to come and have lunch, it's community-oriented, people are very friendly. There is a patio to sit outside. Be back to try some of them.

ixe0WQUT3g4a4hW8RMAePA.text: The C-Clan went to Sit-Stay on grand opening night.  We got there just in time as we took 2 of the last seats at the community table.  The wait was the better part of 1hr to get in afterwards.     We decided to order some corndog bites (though J wanted to order the Scotch Eggs) as a starter.  Mini versions of the jalapeno cheese corndogs...drool!    J's order - The Mac Daddy, which he raved about!  My order - A salad for which I can not remember the name.  Had grilled peaches, chicken sausage, and 2 slices of fried goat cheese.  Perhaps it was the Sunny?  Salad dressing was pretty non-existent.  Though the dog was flavorful, I probably wouldn't order the salad again.      Baby Cs order - Kids polka dot casserole.  A penne pasta with a cheese sauce and slices of hot dog.  Baby C enjoyed the pasta and bites of dog.    Other than my salad, the only thing that would make Sit/Stay better is if they had high chairs.  Baby C had to sit in my lap because unfortunately they only have booster seats.  Baby C is a too small for a booster.  And there's a big difference between going to a restaurant and having a 13month old sit in my lap vs visiting the truck at the Phoenix Public Market and having the baby lap it.   So hopefully they'll have a highchair or two by the time we go again, or maybe we'll just bring our travel highchair.  But all in all, it was a great experience!  We don't have to stalk, er, chase the food truck for our dog fix!  YAY!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0wGBOfWf1YsSWzqSE9M_ig.text: A little expensive for a hot dog, it's still a hot dog. Fried pickles are amazing. Mac and cheese is a bit bland but good. Pretzels are really good. Good place to eat over all. I'll be back!

QFX-ngQ04HtPUNxL_E01Gg.text: Why 4 stars? Because gourmet hot dogs never get old.     ---   ---   ---  I feel like the market of gourmet dogs is undersaturated. I never get tired of visiting these types of places. Eating a hot dog is generally associated with good memories from your childhood, from being at the ballpark, or out at the pool on the 4th of July. Why wouldn't one enjoy a good hot dog?? Maybe because no one is really sure what's inside of those Oscar Meyer weiners. If that's the case, I can understand your hesitation.  Enter: gourmet hot dogs. You get all the pleasures of hot dog nostalgia, sans the mystery meat, but with delightful toppings added on. Everybody wins!  My only "beef" if you will, is that I've had better gourmet dogs elsewhere. Not in Phoenix, but in my journey across the land. On this particular vacation, I had just come from Denver, where Biker Jim's set the bar incredibly high.  But I'd definitely return to Short Leash again!

16lcPZRC3fs1QdXAbt_OdQ.text: Very cute and surrounded by awesome art and scenery. Loved the many options offered :)

R2bhnxzUHDkbpqHZZF1B0A.text: This place is crazy. But the dogs are A+, the beer selection is excellent and the service was friendly. If we lived in Phoenix, we'd be regulars.

KFGvDi4kIjkbjTG8WNXIpQ.text: Hot dogs! My weakness. Since becoming vegetarian, it's been a struggle to find a decent veggie dog and after years of searching, I FOUND IT. The most delicious and unique variety kind too!   Short Leash offers lots of different variety on plain hot dogs but their "build your own" takes the cake! I made my very own concoction of a spicy and savory veggie dog. I love coming here and trying another variation of it. It's definitely worth the 30 min drive! Every time I come, I have to double check that my hot dog is a veggie because it's that good. It doesn't even taste vegetarian. I ordered a salad for the side but I enjoy the chips better. The salad had a bit too much dressing for me.   The price is very reasonable too! On Sunday we came for brunch and ordered jalapeno poppers (homemade, none of that frozen stuff) a mimosa, Mexican sprite, two build your own dogs, AND two delectable donuts  all for under $40 bucks! I love this place. Thank you for existing and catering to us vegetarians. We really do appreciate it.  Now for the service: It's been very good so far. There was one incident where they gave me the wrong hot dog, real vs vegetarian, but they gave me a new one quick. My husband got my veggie dog and he didn't even notice due to the delicious flavors.   Definitely my favorite place to go eat hot dogs! Try it just once. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert!! We were not gonna order but decided we have to try it! Pistachio donut with orange glaze &amp; a cinnamon and sugar donut.
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My veggie hot dog with all the peppers and spicy dressings. Salad was tasty except had a bit too much dressing.
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My husbands build your own with lots of peppers and spicy dressings.

KEnvL-Gjhy_lNMeySVI48Q.text: DELICIOUS!!!  Ordered through ubereats and was excite to  receive the delivery. It was delicious I like how the use a pita type of bread.  I ordered the Devil dog with a spicy beer hot protein. Would definitely eat from here again, next time I will try the Frito pie.

mHdsnZVAcCZJYtgUfDJZHw.text: Really good hotdog! A new look to a regular meal. The Cuban hotdog is really good and the service was decent. It is expensive though. Would go again.

7_IJlZ5F2WhUvtjwbHsz6w.text: We come here quite regularly and love it but, but today my husband felt like a kid finding out that Santa isn't real and not only that, but a smelly guy in bad suit who had a few too many drinks. We are giant fans of the Bear, but today there was so much bacon and bbq sauce that it ruined the experience. Usually that wierd but wonderful mixture of peanut butter, gouda, bbq, bacon, cracker jacks, and spicy dog leave your taste buds awed, inspired, and feeling confused, however today they were crushed by the weight of the salty bacon. No finesse to the flavor combos, just a mass of bacon which when scraped off 2 bites in amounted to more than the hot dog and peanut butter combined! So we will come back but not sure if my husband will dare his beloved Bear again, at least not without saying light on the bacon. He also misses the crumbling of the cracker jacks from years past.  My crispy dogs were delicious though, as well as the fried pickles. The jalapeno poppers were tough though.

FJVw2KEFyngXolYYJMRhBg.text: Oh come on who doesn't like the classic hotdog?!  But here you can take that classic shoved in your face with a myriad of other toppings and assortments.   how is that not the greatest invention since Betty White-- did you know she was invented before the invention of sliced bread? I mean seriously, what the fuck, that's the bee's knees.   Anyway I'm gonna give this 4.5 stars. They obviously have a dam good thing going here some of the best hotdogs my fat ass has ever had.   Now I'm off in search of the best Hot Cats... I have the sneaking suspicion it will be an Asian restaurant that serves them.

Tf0kJeHqxOqXnCSEZTZWoQ.text: Ah, Rollover Donuts. You make my Friday mornings zing. Your dozen assorted donuts make me both the envy and the ire of the office. And those delightful taste combinations make my taste buds sing like an opera.  Conveniently located right off the Encanto light rail stop, Rollover has been a payday Friday staple for our office. The maple glazed bacon lured me in, the Tahitian coconut and orange pistachio and, really, any other combination keep me coming back. I've been fortunate enough to get here right when they open and easily score a terrific assortment of these fried delectable delights. While donuts don't fit in to the revolving office diet, at least I'm assured to have a delish sweet treat throughout the day.  Can't wait for their downtown location to open!

NT_bA-NgR4nsl9-MbYGNXg.text: I too work on a food truck - The American Poutine Co. - and worked a lunch with these guys a few weeks back.  They have KILLER customization options. You start with your type of dog and go from there. They had pre-made specialty combinations, or you could add your own personal toppings from their EXTENSIVE list of options.  I went with a spicy dog, sauerkraut, and mustard. Simple yet elegant, and these guys NAILED it.  Working on a food truck - no matter how GREAT your food is - it becomes boring. So we trade food with other trucks.  Let me just say this: I'm looking forward to seeing them again and getting a delicious hot dog - you should too.  Keep up the good work!!

07HTGCI8I8qKCfPxOqpqww.text: Oh my gosh!!! You are unholy goodness! My favorite hot dog was the Costco Polish Sausage. I've had many other hot dogs, including those New York chili dogs, but this place makes them SUPER unique. My boyfriend and I walked in, looked at the menu, and both agreed to order three to share. We weren't even that hungry!  What we had: -The Sunny: This was our favorite. It's such a refreshing combo of light ingredients. The chicken is amazing, do yourself a favor and do NOT substitute it with any other type of hot dog meat. The pear that was in there gave it some nice crunch and freshness. SO unique. SO GOOD. Will 100% order again. -The Bear: At first I wasn't sure what I was eating. It is a 'salty' dog (doesn't mean that it's too salty though, but that the flavors were more geared toward that). I was really unsure about the Cracker Jack popcorn, but it actually gave it a nice crunch without being distracting! The BBQ sauce gave the entire dog some zest and the peanut butter worked really well with the bacon. It wasn't at all overwhelming. -The Poutine: Very savory. I like the balance of gravy and potatoes. Though it was good, it was my least favorite out of the three. Would I never recommend it? No. I think it was just overshadowed by two other really outstanding hot dogs.  1000% will eat here again!  Also, the nice cashier guy raved about their donuts. I don't even like donuts, but he gave us the last cookie dough donut and IT WAS AMAZING!!!

_USE8U4VGGTU5dt-DNnlOQ.text: The amazing staff opened early to hook up me and my friends with 2 dozen fresh doughnuts! I took the recommendation of a staff member and tried the award winning Thai Coconut doughnut and it did not disappoint. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for unique flavors and something local.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate filled powder doughnuts

72D-UpHJKwxUn3c75IjxzQ.text: Really loved my first visit here. The staff was super friendly and the foot was amazing. I didn't realize there were so many options for hot dogs before this place. The midwesterner in me allowed me to fight the urge to get the Chicago dog and I tried something fun instead. I don't see how you could go wrong, all the food we got was amazing.  We will be back!

P0MAkwLQLYHk0-7ppHohfA.text: Restaurant is close to downtown Phoenix. The parking is on the rear of the restaurant and is free. They have a large patio section that is dog friendly and their restrooms are unisex. They  have a foosball and pool table. You'll be assisted by a server but you'll need to order at the counter (not sure if it's this way when it's busy). The restrooms are also unisex.   I ordered the chili dog (only veggie chili) with an all beef dog and a side of fries. All was tasty. They also don't do fountain drinks. Bottled soda and other drink options. They also have veggie dogs and the staff is friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili dog
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side of fries
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili dog (chili is veggie)

wK3KFTLWiW3q_mSs8afbrA.text: Guess what? I ate hotdog for the first time in my life and wasn't disappointed at all.  Ordered - Moki with veggie weiner : looked like a taco bell taco but tasted really great.   Would highly recommend this place. Lot of options on the menu, really cool ambience, live music, pool table and a Foosball table..what more do you need yeh?

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moki veggie weiner
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xDyS0XxSDQU_rnC61HBjhA.text: My husband and I live super close to Short Leash, and I'm soo glad we finally made it over here! It will definitely become a more regular spot for us. I didn't realize they had such a great beer/cider/wine selection either! Mostly canned, but they have a lot that I want to try :)   We got similar hotdogs - he got the Monika and I got the Crispy Dog (the Monika minus the bacon) - and they were so good! $9 seems a little expensive for a hotdog until you see how huge they are, and for both of these hotdogs you even get two! We both loved them, they were spicy without being too spicy, and a hotdog fried in a corn tortilla is super unique and actually really good.   I of course got a donut on the way out which was good, too! Not the best old fashioned cake donut I've ever had (it didn't seem like a cake donut to me and was kinda doughy in the middle still), but one I would eat again for sure! I'd love to try some more of their fun flavors, I just wasn't feeling any they had left that day.   We also got one of their homemade treats for our puppy, and he loved it! I can't wait to bring him to the restaurant and sit on the patio when he's older. It looks really nice out there :) the inside is really cute, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Monika Dog
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old Fashioned Cake Donut

9wWJheyl0shrFuNd5JAvvg.text: We had been wanting to try this place and after a date night in downtown Phoenix it seemed like the perfect opportunity! It was DELICIOUS!! I cant wait to take an unsuspecting group of friends there and totally blow their minds! Their tastebuds will thank me! #pairofslacksaz #pairofslacks

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. @ryanslack1  Monika Dog
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. @jenbmb Mmmmmm.....Moki Dog!

Jf14pJD8IgpU-4Pepr57LA.text: First time here and hopefully won't be my last. I had the "the bear" and it was bomb! Such a pleasant surprise and who would have thought that peanut butter and a dog would go good?! Very friendly staff and nice setup! I do have to say the building kind of blends in so if your not paying close attention, you will pass it. I did lol I also ordered the fried green tomatoes, I love fried green tomatoes but these just didn't do it for me. Not that it doesn't have potential to be delicious because it does, it's just sliced too thick for my liking. They have an outside covered patio with misters which is great! I had my dog with me outside. If it's not service it can't come it, but you can place the order from outside, they will work with you! I would definitely suggest coming here and hanging out And grabbing some good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried green tomatoes
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bear minus cracker jacks - delicious!

RkMYfP4itLvB_1myDo9siQ.text: Absolutely the best customer service I have ever had at a restaurant and the food is amazing. I've been here a few times now but when 8 of us came in for my birthday we were welcomed with a plate full of mini doughnuts, a samole Bear dog and table side service with a smile. One of my favorite Az spots for grub and beverage.  Try one of their pairings of you get a chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AnTy3xt3hw2p1lh5k_M-Jw.text: I moved around the area, and I was trying to browse through Yelp and found this gem right next to my apartment! It's a pet friendly place so you can bring your furry friend along and have a seat in the patio. There's ample amount of parking behind the restaurant as well. Their employees are all SUPER friendly... like no joke... As for the food, the price is very worth it for the quality and taste. I got their oliver hot dog and it was served with naan instead of a traditional hot dog bun. I LOVE NAAN so I think that using it as their bread is GENIUS. It was very tasty and filling, and I will definitely be back again!   I saw some of their doughnuts and that is also one of the things that's in my list to get from their menu as well. They looked so tasty and appetizing!   Oh and they also have treats available for doggos, which I thought was pretty neat! Anyways, A+++++ restaurant all around for me, and I cannot wait to bring my boyfriend, family, and friends in one day with me!

mYRlcf8rpDGbap3KnPzAdg.text: A darn good hotdog.  Family friendly, creative menu, and helpful servers.  Great beer selection, too.  I can fully vouch for the yumminess of the doughnuts as well.

PMNigHgsZCaH0hYBNeuNvQ.text: Many of my friends have been regulars here and I finally got the opportunity to try.  The place is a medium size inside with a fairly spacious patio (which will be great during the fall-spring season).  They have some games, regular seating and bar seating.  The ladies that greeted me and took my order were friendly.  I opted to try the BEAR - with an all beef hot dog and it contained peanut butter, smoked gouda, bacon, BBQ sauce, cracker jacks and added a side of deep fried pickles.  Interesting combination but hits all the sensations for the palate and it works well together.  The pickle were fried with a light batter and still fairly juicy.  Just a word to the wise, not sure if their AC was out or if they only have evaporative/swamp cooler.  I was not comfortable (heavy and sticky), but that could just be me.  Don't get me wrong, I will be back, but might wait until the monsoon season is over...

ZJw7srImqurer_D7oxeTcA.text: Great Dogs, live music and fun atmosphere We enjoyed the live music during our visit.

8Dkd75mZRn4b5C5lIxiW7w.text: Stopped in at lunch while in town for a conference.  Everyone in our group was impressed by how large the portions were for the hot dogs. The choice of using the flatbread instead of a traditional hot dog bun makes a lot of sense to hold all the toppings.  I got the Cubano and it was covered with so many toppings it was almost too much food for me.  My boyfriend got one that was unexpectedly amazing: hotlink, bbq sauce, peanut butter, smoked gouda cheese, and topped with cracker jacks! The person in front of us in line vouched for it so he got it and we were all impressed with how well it came together.  We finished our meal by splitting a doughnut. It was tasty but we were disappointed by the lack of selection by the time we arrived around 1 PM.

cS9Uam1pnlDkgkJ-grlpXw.text: The meal I had was meh.   What REALLY irks me is that now I get marketing email from them. How?!?  The unsubscribe link sent me to a url under squaremarketing. Square is a company that processes mobile card payments. So it seems that Square is fine fishing around the web for my email address and selling service to a hot dog stand so them can spam me with more email.   Short Leash, I did not wish to be placed on your emarketing lists just because I bought a darn hot dog from you. Just because I helped your business doesn't mean you get to get all up in mine.

O4nCny8K78CuP20eInEIUw.text: This place is amazing. Huge portions and everything we ordered was delicious. Love the theme and that they give back. Will be back next time in Phx.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cuban dog, poutine fries and Mac and cheese flight

i-WE7eeVU9RiQGv5MPUXRA.text: I  was torn when I heard Short Leash was opening right down the street from me. That means I have to have the will power not to stop in every time I drive home. UGH. I stopped in the other day. The Chicago dog was delicious as always.   My friend tried the Cubano and I took a huge bite of it (much to his dismay). I think he won lunch, the Cubano was out of this world and what I am getting when I crack again on my way home from yoga.  As though inhaling one huge dog wasn't enough I also got the fried pickles. They were good, but almost a bit too sweet. I washed it all down with a Mexican coke and drove home basking in my guilt.

7Ii2-4tueY5kqGeVSlVppg.text: I am not sure that I can describe how much I like this place. I had previously eaten from one of their food trucks before they opened up this awesome location. First of all the food is awesome, they have fantastic hot dogs that you can have vegetarian.  They are really good veggie dogs if you are a vegetarian.  They have an awesome selection of starters including Cauliflower buffalo wings, which are totally amazing and out of this world.  The beer selection is fantastic and if you go for happy hour the prices can not be beat. I sat at the bar and the service was also top notch. The owner was there and talked with us for quite a while, just adding to the great experience. The building has plenty of seating and also they have some foosball tables for fun. All I can tell you is stop in and try it out,  you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yhsyW3x2A0MRAZtJnzggTA.text: Just moved to this area.  My wife and I stopped in for a couple of beers, appetizers and to play some games.  Restaurant concept is a ton of fun.  The fried pickles were terrific (sweetish pickles with spicy dipping sauce which was different and quite good).  My wife really enjoyed the corn dog bites and both apps were BIG portions.  I've had their donuts and they are AMAZING!  Highly recommend.

YtXOOve3kjYMzM4AKkrj9A.text: Short Leash Hotdogs is sort of a free-for-all of hot dog places in the sense that - well, pretty much nothing appears to be off limits. Many of their dog creations are unique and downright strange, but I'm pretty sure you're bound to find something that works for you.  I wouldn't go so far as to say that these are chef-driven creations. They're merely just creative takes on traditional dogs that are unlike anything else you're bound to find in Phoenix.   I ordered a Mac Daddy, which consists of mac and cheese, chili, and a beef dog that's stuffed into a naan-type bread as opposed to the traditional bun. My girlfriend chose the pretzel dog, which is wrapped in pretzel bread and allows you the option to choose between either cheese or mustard dip. Although since we weren't asked what we wanted, I guess cheese dip is the default.  Both dogs were fine, but addressing mine in particular and to channel another Yelp review, there comes a point where the toppings become less of a compliment to the dog and literally become the meal itself. It's a bit excessive, although there was indeed a dog buried deep within the mountain of mac and chili when I went searching.  The starter of pimento cheese and chips that we chose was fine. We both enjoyed the chips, while the pimento was average and nowhere near the level of the mind-blowingly great pimento you'll find at a place like LGO.  The doughnut = A disgrace.  I could care less about creativity when it comes to donuts. A great straight-up raised and glazed or traditional cake donut is all that's needed to win me over. Since neither of these options were available, my girlfriend chose a single vanilla glazed. I'm not sure what this thing was, but it definitely wasn't what we'd call a legitimate donut. It tasted like soft bread, somewhere between a croissant and an old biscuit. It was a big disappointment.   In summary, I see this as late-night drunken food that's incredibly heavy and something that I'd probably never eat regularly due to the wrath it might invoke on my sensitive stomach. On the plus side, I really like their wall of dog photos - because seriously, how can you not like it?  Recommended to try, but probably not for everyone.

YgXc_aiphXmazD7ENkaMag.text: I had to try it given the name alone.. this use to be an Italian restaurant and they have redone it nicely! I loved the space that included a pool table, games for the table and a bar. Sadly they only had one doughnut left which was really why I said yes when my fiance asked to go here but I took that classic doughnut and had them box it up and we ordered drinks so I was happy. The naan like bread for the dogs/brats etc were perfectly warm and soft yet with a little crisp to them. The portions and items where perfectly matched. I loved it so much I couldn't finish it all. The poutine fries would have been perfect if they put them under a salamander to melt the cheese and warm the gravy. I haven't been back yet but probably will at some point and when I do I will ask for them to do that which would probably make me want to come in even more. Great place, guy loved everything the brought and the doughnut we took home and shared made the night. It was an amazing doughnut! Ok, just writing this makes me want to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dog with toppings like the French fries
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drinks w/view of the pool table and board games.
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dog w/fried green tomatoes

FGC_-uZSgF_HrQ76MButgQ.text: I got some small gripes about this place. Overall I think its great though. I got a poutine dog and the bratwurst stuffed pretzel. I also tried a classic doughnut and doughnut holes.  The poutine dog was everything I love about Phoenix food. Different and interesting . The hot dog itself was majorly impressive in its own right. I actually loved the Nann bread as the "bun"  The stuffed bratwurst was a a major disappointment. The brat itself didn't seem that fresh and kinda gross. The pretzel bun was not salty at all. With the sauerkraut and the mustard which was super overpowering in the sweet department needed the pretzel bun to be salty. The cheese on it was good.    Maybe it just wasn't my style.  Now the doughnuts. The classic Doughnut has some "weight to it". Very cakey. No glaze just a homemade style frosting. They get points for their dounghnuts not tasting like every place in AZ. Though I definitely felt like these were 2 days old at-least. The doughnut holes which were chocolate had just the faintest chocolate flavor in the dough. No glaze just powdered. They also did not leave a oil aftertaste.   Will go back to try the mac dog. If I didn't get my order to go I would have asked to have my bratwurst comped because it was kinda gross.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine dog
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Doughnuts i did eat some before taking photo

MRcrUE7vfXnwFo2rNYin-w.text: Caught them on an off moment or something..I ordered lime soda, and a lady with a bleu cheese side salad. Received lemon, and a lady with a vinaigrette side salad..but that didn't matter, because I never got a fork to eat it with. By the time she came back, I had eaten the average hot dog concoction, built on naan, with indecipherable flavors that didn't taste like the description. I mentioned the dressing error, and no fork thing and asked for only the check. She runs in the back trying to remake the salad, or repair the error, which took another 5mins. I throw $15 on the table, hoping that will cover it, and start to leave..she comes out with salad in hand, still no check..maybe a food truck is the best bet.

h0bMzJiZgX-6wGHDxuhCoQ.text: Best Hot Dogs in Arizona, great beer on tap, and an assortment of good eats. Definitely a new addiction!!

SEf2SDjpxT9ckaZYFMmq-w.text: Top notch service! Brittany was kind, attentive and knowledgable. So hard to find in downtown phoenix. Bartender was great too. Check it out!

DXj2ct_E5ksI2n2Q4mwOlQ.text: We had the pleasure of trying Short Leash's dogs at Yelp event and we were not disappointed (thanks, Lindsey D.). My hubby and I shared one and luckily he made good choices when choosing toppings. All of their dogs are served on Naan which is fantastical! The hubs chose jalapenos, green chiles, pinto beans, ketchup, and mustard in a spicy beer brat. YUH-MEE! I hope I see this truck again...I'm gettin' my own next time!!

4l25rmRDjcWcqlz671810Q.text: My friend and I came into Short Leash on Wednesday night to grab dinner before her tattoo appointment at Golden Rule. We only had about 15 minutes to get our food and eat. We asked if they could make it happen that quick, and they did. We were served by a really nice tall guy with a full beard and tattoos. He made sure that we got our food, our check, and out the door in time to make her 6pm appointment. His service was great, and the food was delicious. I only regret that I didn't have more time to savor my hot dog. I'll definitely be back when I have more time to enjoy!

mifnQkatZaLOPNX8PYw8wg.text: What a nice little surprise in Downtown Phoenix! I stopped here on a whim for lunch, and didn't even check Yelp 1st! I know, quite unusual from me, so yes, I was a little nervous! haha Small place with a full bar and huge beer list! Whats the story here? Gourmet-Simple Sausages! They have 3 types of Sausage(Beef Brat, Hot Beer Sausage, Chicken Sausage) served on a piece of Naan(Indian flatbread) They offer about 10 of their own creations as far as topping combos, but they also have a Build Your Own option with probably 25 different toppings to choose from.  I decided to go for their Special of the Day(Week maybe) which was Bleu Cheese, Bacon, Arugula. And chose the Hot Beer Sausage. It was delicious! Great flavor from the bacon and sausage, and the bleu cheese just brought it all together.  They also have another specialty here, Insane Donuts with a kiss of artistic flair!  I was so tempted by the dessert menu that I went for an Apple Fritter with caramel! It didn't disappoint at all!  While I was leaving, I noticed they also have a Food Truck! Actually, 2! One looked to be Donuts only and the other was much larger and seemed to be their Mobile Sausage Delivery Unit for the hungry people of Phoenix!  Check this place out if you want a modern twist on the age old Cased Meat!

GZdRAfMeL-VaqgPRy2YOhA.text: I'd go back even tho I had the Bear, and really thought is was too sweet.  Next time I'm doing the build-your-own hotdog, but overall I like this concept.  Kinky, cute idea you won't find any place else. Don't think this is some cheap hot dog place as 2 gourmet dogs, 2 beers, one fried pickles and one corn dog appetizer with tip came up to $45.  The corn dog appetizer is HUGE, so the son took it to his girl's afterward to share.   The fried pickles were great to me, so I'd come back just for that being the big fried pickle fan that I am....and darn, if it isn't hard to find good ones and these are good! Very good!!! They have a wide variety of canned beers for $3 which was fun to choose.  I got something peachy which was decent. This is a cute place for a date I think, however, I saw people here with little kids and for $8.50 a dog not sure if I would take little ones here.  Another adult, tho, you bet. The food is good, the service was great, the concept is beyond clever considering this place is a little tiny room with a minimum of decor.  Someone who owns this place is mighty clever as a marketer.  I admire them anyway for their creativity if nothing else and taking a very simple product (hot dog) and spiffing them up, serve a few good sides, cans of beer (no glasses, no washing) and charge healthy prices = clever. This one is a "gonna return" to....I really liked it overall alot.

oviLieEPRzhNg2UuwWUCxw.text: Stopped by on a Friday at 9:30. I am not the biggest hot dog fan of all time, but wanted to try it after reading the reviews. I'm a plain kind of girl, so I got the build your own with regular hot dog, cheddar, raw onion, ketchup and mustard. Now, this may seem plain and boring to you, but to me, it was the best hot dog I've ever had!! I think the naan bread puts it over the top. The chips were quite delicious, too. I got a ballast point pale ale that was very good with the hot dog. The person I was with got the goat cheese salad and said it was very good. Our waitress was great and attentive. Highly recommended!!

1ViD1dB8ZY4BYe8i3wmW-A.text: We stopped in for lunch.   Started with the green tomato stack, which was really good.   We went with the Akko and the devil dog.   Each was o.k.   I was bummed that they were already "out" of a lot of options I wanted...no spicy beer dog, no polish...so we had to go with regular dogs which aren't worth the $9.00 premium.   The chips were fresh and pretty good although a little under seasoned.   I was a little thrown off that the fried pickles didn't come with a dipping sauce and unfortunately I didn't see my server again until it was already too late.   The pluses...the naan makes for a better dog.

nL4W6_t6dtFsbx-gCF9tSw.text: I got the Mac and cheese hot dog a few days ago and it was very good, I also really enjoyed their kettle cooked chips. Would definitely suggest getting their all need hot dog instead of the regular one. Only complaint is that I think it's a little overpriced. $9.50 plus tax and tip, and that doesn't include a drink.

cvQiZFr05p3NmvoivS-HMA.text: 5 star dogs... Service was a bit slow - we came at opening with a baby and a toddler which means we don't get to casually converse and linger - but somehow we lasted a whole hour and then some, and service was friendly. The kids' mac and cheese looked so good I had to steal a few bites from my little one. It was good. The hot dog combos were delicious. Overall, we loved it and we'll be back.

5o3eQCQfPFA3_IcJT_GELw.text: I absolutely love this place. The owners are awesome. The customer service is on point. They have a wide selection of craft beer.

U0TlQn-s39R4_kwhOnU9CQ.text: Went there on a First Friday, early enough that we didn't wait for a table.  Server was fairly prompt in getting our drink orders.  There was some confusion about an appetizer being available or not (it was but another server told us it wasn't...lol).  Placed our order, (Preztel dog and Mac Daddy bowl w/ Beef and beans) the scotch eggs were pretty good, not the best I've ever had, will have to come in and try them when they're fresher.  Entree's came out, one was spot on and correct, mine had to be returned to the kitchen as it was incorrect.  When it arrived, it was correct and very tasty.  The restaurant went above and beyond, imo,  to ensure that we were pleased with our meal.  It being a First Friday downtown would be why I expect the service was somewhat slow, they may have been understaffed or just swamped.  Server was very nice and I look forward to going back again.  The food receives a 3.5-4 stars... the service and attitude.. 5 Stars all the way!

qGEgKWYGrAIYIjwwRNlUzg.text: Their truck was invited to my office event and there was a long line to go with their reputation for churning out tasty, unique dogs.  Soooo good, sooo different, snappy dogs.  Made to order but worth the wait. Too bad they are not located in Tempe in their own brick n mortar.  So it is a special treat to see them at an event.

8CDATukqTwWuD9tkXPTB5A.text: Not bad.  It does get rid of two cravings.  Flat bread and hotdogs.  lol  Service was great and it seems they do a lot for the community.

xUsNI6CB-QZs7ZANoY_VkA.text: The staff is great, food is great, beer is great, and you don't break the bank. Downtown needs more places like this.

m-ArZX56sK0vq_LAbYUnBw.text: It does not get better than this.  I'm not one for hot dogs, so I always opt for the chicken dog. They have some crazy combinations that are absolutley fabulous. The pita bread they use for the bun puts it above the rest. It's different for sure, but so worth the money. It's filling for sure!  They feature a dog of the week sent in by customers which is pretty cool.  I never thought anything gourmet could be sold out of a truck, but Short Leash proved me wrong!

kZoqtrwXPtN8WyXIg2Zuaw.text: Great space, service is great, but the doughnuts were dry, frosting was over the top sugary, and there wasn't a great selection. We had chocolate glaze on raised, pistachio orange glaze on cake, and the choc chip cookie dough glaze on cake - all had the same problems.  I'm hopeful that they're just working out the kinks.  There's definitely room in Phoenix for a solid doughnut shop.

smWlBAFnkieRXY2zArqKhA.text: Let me start by saying that I don't typically like hot dogs....honestly, I hardly EVER eat one. The only other place I will order a hot dog is at Pinks in LA or Vegas.  We tried Short Leash for the first time Thursday night. For the month of October they are parked at Jam Market in Old Town every Thursday from 4PM-8PM. Since they mainly set up shop in Central Phoenix and we live in Arcadia, we decided this would be our best bet!  Holy delicious. It was honestly one of the best things I've had in a long time. After drooling over the menu for a few minutes, I decided on the Aiko with a chicken dog. Brad was taking orders and when I told him I wanted to sub the mayo for spicy mustard, he was quick to offer up his suggestion of trying sriracha instead. I always appreciate when people give you their suggestions on what can make your meal that much better and the sriracha did just that...it was AMAZING. Now I like my food super spicy so I also added pepperoncinis and even got a little spicy mustard on the side.  Next up....fried pickles! These were awesome too! Thick cut and breaded perfectly! Now I'm a huge fried pickle fan (I like the chips VS the spears) and with not many valley spots offering up these tasty treats, I was super stoked they had them. I actually ended up dipping these in the spicy mustard...and sriracha. I know, I have problems.  Now my boyfriend on the other hand is a major hot dog fan, however, he typically doesn't stray too far from the standard hot dog with ketchup. Thursday night he decided to go with their featured special which was named after an adorable pup named Desi. This one came with a smoked Italian sausage, peppers, onions & garlic all slow cooked in a red wine tomato sauce and topped with shaved parmesan. He LOVED it. Cleaned his plate. I was somewhat skeptical of how he would like the naan that it comes on instead of a bun but it didn't phase him one bit!  Overall, we were two happy campers! The only thing I would love to see are french fries or tater tots gracing their menu!

wh09hnaKurxKhxb0B7GWXA.text: This was a great experience! Had an awesome bartender/server, Brittany! She was definitely busy between the bar and the floor, but she remained very sweet, patient and suggestive! She went over the beer list and took the time to let me taste the local beer on draft. Also, as curious as I was about the Bear Dog, I was still very unsure! She encouraged me to try it and suggested I pair it with the spicy beer dog! Hands down the best hot dog I have ever had! Thanks Brittany for being so kind and attentive and thanks to the cook that prepared my food! Two thumbs up! I will definitely return!

94IN8hKZ-sbUt4k8xpq14A.text: Just had a Chicago style bratwurst. Excellent! They use  nan instead of buns and it works perfectly. You won't have mustard on your tie.   The fries were enjoyable.   Service was excellent.  Everything was!

5_vTiM1TfQVE3-DkoCirng.text: Back in the day [about a month ago] when they were 'just' a food truck they were my Wednesday dinner at the downtown Farmers Market and alternate Fridays at the empty lot on Camelback.  Now I have to bike all the way 2 blocks north to their sit down restaurant to get my Wednesday fix.  Worth it. The only place I eat hot dogs in America.  What's up with the empty lot now? Who knows - who cares

QrxN6_nv_dhu-fioViXLIA.text: This place is just fun. From the different and varied combinations they throw out there, the flat bread that will make You never want a bun again, to the great sausages this place is a blast.   I had the bear which had peanut butter, cracker jacks, and BBQ sauce and it was a great hot dog. The tangy BBQ and the peanut butter worked well together and the cracker jacks added some needed texture.   If your looking for something fun ad delicious I would check out short leash

4FdoGGtfXwaRT1rDzMvM3A.text: I sought this out because Yelp caught my eye with it being on their "Best of Yelp Phoenix Restaurants" so I made a deliberate drive to get there, ate what I though was representative and think Yelp has this one wrong. First of all Yelp, it isn't a restaurant that you claim but a food truck, a very small food truck. But I had read the Yelp reviews and knew that. I stepped up and had trouble finding the ordering line through the people. While there wasn't a big group ordering, about 6 people were clustered around blocking the window, apparently waiting for their orders to appear. Turns out it would be a long wait, but good things are worth waiting for, right? I sorted through those waiting, politely asked and found there was no line and made my way to the window. I ordered the Beef Moki and because of the positive Yelp comments, added a side of fried pickle. Total was $8 without a drink (I got one of the fruit drinks at the other trucks there). Window guy said it would be about 7 mins, which caused me to look at my Droid - 1:22PM. At 1:38PM my Moki arrived but there was a few minutes more wait for the fried pickle which wasn't ready yet. Took 20 mins total and this was well past peak lunch hour. Sat down and looked at what I got (see photos I took). Other Yelpers are right, the dog is small. The Moki is listed as having green chilis, onions, tomatos, pinto beans, cheddar & mayo. I was anticipating a nice SouthWestern style blend of flavors, but that was absent. I bit in and none of these flavors jumped out, no chili heat, no flavor burst, no taste of fresh veggies melding. What I did get was a sensation of the tough skin texture of the dog, very thick naan bread and a pinto bean absorbtion. Turning to the fried pickle, its breading kept falling off just leaving the limp, soggy pickle. I finished the 7 pieces of fried pickle that I had paid $3 for and wondered why the ratings were so high. The dining area I sat in was very windy, blowing fiercely which made the experience forced; a hand off between eating and holding down anything that I had ordered. Hours later, my iron stomach is still getting belch tones from the dog's meat spices and oil based aromas. This isn't good. Unless you're working right across the street and this place was the utmost in convenience, I'd pass. The flavors didn't work or even stand out, the service was incredibly slow, and the eating area was dumpy and windy. Spending $8 for "a dog and pickles" then add an additional cost of a drink beyond that, you are already at sit down restaurant prices found elsewhere nearby. I just don't see what the ravings are all about at this place. Heck, I saw a Pita Jungle a few blocks before and wondered why I would pass that up to come here. SIDE NOTE - I went back and read some of the prior Yelp reviews. I just don't get how reviewers are giving this place such high ratings. Here is a review that rated 4 stars but stated it was only held back from 5 stars because; -small dog, -undercooked naan, -toppings flavors don't fuse together, -neglected service, -overpriced yelp.com/biz/short-leash... wtf - Yelp, you've let me down.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moki and fried pickles
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sign board
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. March 4, 2011

xlCPHtjlLgXF_v_p4jk4Qw.text: Place is very modern and inviting. The devil dog with a brat was amazing! It's delivered on a pita flat which was also very tasty. Jalepenos and peppers mixed with the cheese was almost too good. Service was prompt and friendly. Tea was fresh, firing on all cylinders. If you find yourself downtown or on Roosevelt Row, stop in. Oh, and the price is WAY too low, I expected my meal to be at least 20, nope 9 bucks. The tip I'm sure made up for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I present &#34;The Devil Dog&#34; with a brat. Now in a food coma...

eUP1i8WFvWbl2ST8oCOQ8g.text: This food truck is DELICIOUS!  Everything is made with high quality ingredients, and I have yet to try something that I didn't love!  This place is not your normal take on the hot dog.  Though, if that's your fancy then you can still get it :)  I can't wait for the restaurant to open up on Roosevelt!

uwAMiOjLVG0TO1uhQqQaXw.text: Short Leash and I are one. Brad and Katherine are super nice and you cant go wrong with anything u order.  Recommendation: Torn between 2? ask then to split a dog. Also, Try the fried pickles at least once in your life.  FYI: you ever get a chance to try the SUNNY, do it!!! thats my pup!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Features dog of the week: my pup SUNNY.

07JXiCz44lJf-6I3gNsN8w.text: Supremely unimpressed!  Waited 10 minutes in a mostly empty restaurant to be waited on and waitress when she finally came over was unapologetic.  Food was incredibly overpriced for what it was - hot dogs - and the donuts were mediocre at best, the bear do it was actually disgusting - the only bright spots was the spicy Thai coconut donut and the fried pickles.  Overall don't waste your time or money here.

v9s_VmFa6k1_tmt6962HoA.text: Delicious hot dogs. We have been following Short Leash around since we first came across it. They had just started out as a food truck and were selling food at a beer festival a few years ago. The owner would make us our hot dogs and knew us by name. Not only is the food delicious but the customer service has and is always great.  This place is definitely a favorite.  All I have to say is that it's rated as one of the best places to eat in Phoenix for a reason. You cannot go wrong with the infamous Bear.

UmwddBXnSimB-MYG-xlHmA.text: Great little boutique  Service was perfect, food and coffee were on point! Definitely a come back too when in town. Worth the visit especially if you have a pet :)

_BfRWDLYfc_qh9NGeCmUag.text: Not only are the hot dogs so fun and unique the staff is friendly and owners responsive.  We have hit up short leash for a quick dinner a few times and also had them bring the truck to an event for our church.  They were super friendly helpful and served up tasty dogs for our entire group. If looking for a fun dinner with the family or to cater a large group check out Short Leash.

21KM5UF_c1ob6XJrcCGn9w.text: The best hot dog I have ever had! My choice of the day was Oliver (Swiss cheese, 1000 island dressing and  sauerkraut). Can't wait to go back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fFxETQBuPuyqXl8E8TcfMg.text: Small restaurant but very bright and I think there is also a patio but I sat inside. The staff was very nice and the food was so good, I will definitely come back.

J_gRJTW77rAImqUJ9oW5aw.text: Unleash your hot dog inhibitions and enjoy a fresh, local take on a time honored street food.  The Na an bread bun is a stroke of genius and their commitment to sourcing their food locally will definitely endear themselves to the locals.  My only complaint?  That they'd expand their coverage and set up shop closer to home.

yVwAlWawSrpm2lC9-GW_bg.text: My husband and I went to Short Leash for lunch and it was such a great experience.  The staff was very inviting and helpful and the food was RIDICULOUS!!!  I ordered the Aiko with a vegetarian dog and my husband ordered the Monika.  Both of these dishes were just so different and sooo DELICIOUS!  To top it off our side dish that we ordered and shared was the Arugala salad and OH MY GOSH it was just heaven!!!!  The food here is truly AMAZING and it needs to be eaten!!!  We will be back!

6f04tt1dcMeKu1Yj13RYpw.text: Delicious food cart.    The spicy beer hot dog is the best.    They messed up my order and gave me the wrong version of the right dog and it was delicious.  I wanted  Aiko (mango chutney) but I got the Oliver.    I did not give it five stars because its more expensive than it should be.  However, the people keep lining up.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The maki with bratwurst

XGwmV3DrdIlQXMPDUp5qJA.text: Went for an early lunch with my wife last week. I had the Oliver, which was tasty but very greasy and quite heavy. She had corn dogs which I thought were awful. At first they came out with raw batter inside- staff was very pleasant and comped the corn dogs. They came back and the batter just tasted bizarre. I couldn't put my finger on why- perhaps too much pepper? But it wasn't what she wanted or expected. The chips were slightly stale and chewy but had great flavor.  The ambiance and service were great and I couldn't give less than 3 stars to a place smart enough to serve a hot dog on naan (my favorite) but we won't be returning. Would much rather go to teds which is more classic, simple and well done.

NySjxBr15z9FytJW5VLcNg.text: After a year of wishful thinking, I finally got an opportunity to try this place out; I was not disappointed.  I drug my boyfriend out to the four peaks tasting room where I saw Short leash was set up a couple hours; heck what could be better than beer and hotdogs?!?!?  I ordered the moki and it was soooooo good.  I love that they don't use regular hotdog buns here, instead they opt for naan bread which has way better flavor.  I'm definitely looking forward to coming back some time for a second round:)

54gXeMhHQVuAE_4GL_Artw.text: This is a cool place downtown for some delish dogs and donuts! I recommend anything in a pretzel roll, but the flat bread is good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel brat so delicious!

6SMNk5CuAjg7gpAFTZPlAw.text: We loved this place.  A group from the neighborhood rode our bikes down and were there when they opened for lunch.  We started off with the Scotch Eggs that we all shared and I would highly recommend.  Delicious.  We all tried different hot dogs and all loved them.  I like that many are served on naan bread and others served on quality rolls.  The side I chose with my dog was the cole slaw and it was really good.  It's a mayo based dressing but not heavy.  Good beers and a friendly staff.

DxB_bDtmLaf8kE6QCET-Og.text: Great local spot!  From a wonderful food truck comes a wonderful sit down.  I loved the beer selection and the food is excellent.  I suggest the fried pickles or corn dog to start off with, after that it's up to you.    Thank you Short Leash for being an example of the Phoenix pride, you are models of a great business plan and community leaders.

-s0W98uIu8pn0QtI70q00Q.text: Been here several times and try to order something different each time. This time was the bratwurst with saurkraut with sweet Bavarian mustard, with jalapeno poppers. The poppers are fresh and very tasty. Bratwurst is served in nan rather than a bun. Delicious. They let you sample the draft drinks which is nice. Super nice wait staff and an all around great experience

_f-U54sWSlSRsrrD-kcuNQ.text: I love this place! They have great vegetarian dogs, and the waiters/esses are friendly and helpful, and they bring you some great food... What's not to love? The hand cut chips are one of my favorite things, but then so is The devil dog, the sunny, fried green tomatoes salad... I've seriously never had anything here I didn't like! Oh and the specials are pretty cool too!  Thanks for being a great neighborhood restaurant!

q-u36d_QgzLwklnzoiPnug.text: Listen. And Listen Carefully.   These hot dogs are unlike anything you've ever experienced. My company sponsors a weekly "Food Truck Wednesday" event and ever since my first experience, I wait in anticipation to see if Short Leash Dogs will be there. Literally like a kid waiting for Christmas.   I ordered my own hot dog creation, I don't remember what was in it. But it was so good, I had to put the hot dog down after the first bite to make sure it was real.   I rarely eat hot dogs and I primarily consume them twice a year during a typical Labor Day or Memorial Day BBQ but I will travel for Short Leash Dogs. Yes, I said, Travel for a Hot Dog!   It's that real.

0B039ltibi_S8nII_jt6uw.text: -Bear-yum!! Our fave. -Sunny-okay, prob try something else. -Crispy dogs- Hubby thought pretty tasty but prefers the Bear. I liked the cheesy sausage inside but not really the crispy tortilla shell. Still... Probably worth having once. -Devil dog-second to the Bear (per hubby) -lemonade- delishhhh  This is surely a place I need to come back many times so I can try everything!

xopb5JSYiYttQNCxfdq-TQ.text: Came in and was greeted immediately. Nice atmosphere, ingredients tasted so fresh. Got the jalapeno poppers--so good!  The devil dog was very good as well. Get some dragon sauce on the side for it and some fries and your meal will be great.  I would definitely come back!

t1oWMeDZMcNXiElKGX7mYQ.text: Great spot we stopped at, dogs were delish, fried pickles were really good and the craft beer selection is on point, Odell Brewing was there and a pinewood derby just happened to be going in, will return again for sure.

8P8lnkcTbmudVkYcDqk8ng.text: The Phoenix food truck scene is finally taking off. We have almost every kind of gourmet food truck that other cities are proud to showcase. The first thing you will notice when approaching Short leash is their huge line, while virtually every other food truck doesn't have a line. Don't be tempted to leave. The lines are long- but completely worth it. Just a mustard dog kind of person? Don't be boring! Shortleash aren't just any hot dog...don't be afraid! My first glance at the menu, I was intrigued. Mango Chutney? Mayonnaise? hmmm...  After my first Short Leash- I was sold! I love trying their special of the day in order to try the latest and greatest concoction. I just had one that I still talk about that included a pretzal bun and apple cole slaw. Yum! Try it once, and you'll be hooked!

S4iMLx-BwOSHbodb7gVk-w.text: We tried going opening day, but decided not to wait the 45 min.  So glad we went back today.  I had the bratwurst Igby and it left my mouth tingling.  Wonderful flavor and crisp.   We sat at the bar and really enjoyed talking with the staff and other customers.  Everyone was supper nice, and the owners are really a wonderful part of our community.

iWU7COw5igGPWS7Gwq5CwQ.text: Once upon a time, I tried the Short Leash Dogs food truck at a the first play date at the Children's Museum. I've longed to get back to them again since that time.  I finally did and I absolutely loved it! I love the naan for a bun and the kettle chips were amazing! I had an extremely difficult time trying to choose which thing to try, everything looked yummy!  I can't wait to try more of the menu, next time!

8dmBLILXmw-4oNzR1ZspXg.text: Incredibly friendly...to people, to dogs, to doughnut lovers. On this Ohioans first trip to Phoenix, the employee ran me through all the flavors and was incredibly kind. Settled on the Thai coconut and pistachio donuts. Delicious. Please go. And Rollover, please have a mandatory fun trip to the Grand Canyon for all your employees. :)

gaKA3vUzODTtBgbASkGozg.text: Over the past year, I have patronized Short Leash on Roosevelt several times.  The food is delicious, different and enjoyable.    BUT... it is really the staff that makes this place work.  A server is supposed to ask if everything is okay, or if you need anything else.  Here, you feel less like a customer and more like a guest.

yppr1WP8MEhBixEMgl51pA.text: I visited with some friends and one of the servers had an attitude whilst serving us. He got food and drinks wrong, but didn't really seem to care that it impacted our experience. An email to the owners proved this business cares about its customers and their experiences. I would not hesitate to return again.  Food is really good and you should try this place.

O01GKjN_84wiqp13NCCkBg.text: I always get naked veggie dogs with lots of saurkraut, gouda, banana peppers, tomatoes and mustard! It's amazing.   If you haven't had their fried pickels, it's a MUST!  I work in North Scottsdale so I get very excited when they will be in the Whole Foods parking lot, however I only made the mistake of going at noon once. I spent almost an hour in line, but it was sooo worth it.

PYTAtjdMQJ5KGHnV_Dl6Vw.text: If you haven't been here, you MUST try The Lady! Soooo delicious and the fried pickles are amazing as well. The staff is super friendly!

qHYMzx8zEfij7aVnec8gqA.text: Nice work reinventing the hot dog, especially for a vegetarian. I've visited the food truck several times and decided to try Sit...Stay. It did not disappoint. I was craving the veggie lady so bad, so I begged my husband and we made the 25 minute trip downtown to get a fix.   Simple casual decor with a nice bar - seating for 8-10 and several tables, including a community table.   Started with the fried pickles, nomnomnom, and some local brews.   I ordered the veggie lady - such a simple thing, but I am seriously addicted. My husband ordered the spicy beer hot devil dog with a side of mango chutney and he loved it too.   Open a north Scottsdale location, maybe a quick window service style in The Quarter?
