dw8rkBC7aPkGZAEpTlqnxQ.text: Came in here earlier for a donut and didn't realize that Rollover Donuts and SLHD were connected! I got a donut and some Frito Pie. The Frito Pie is really from the kid's menu but it was perfect as a snack and surprisingly filling! Other kid's items include a corn dogs and a mac & cheese casserole.   *Easily accessible via Lightrail  Coming back to try one of their 20 dogs and hope to catch their food truck sometime.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dog wall
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Exterior

fbTPzmsAzKS_OmPDH1IWRg.text: I'm in love with this place. I never ate at the food truck, but we've been coming to the restaurant for several years - it's our tradition after one of us gets a new tattoo! Otherwise we don't typically drive to this part of town.  Anyways, it was amazing with waiters coming to the table, and now it's a walk-up counter and I hated it, but they've renovated recently and I think it's awesome again! The donuts are delish, and I'm totally in love with the dogs!  My favorite is the "Sunny" with pear and prosciutto. And even though the naan is unbelievable, now I get it "naked" and they cut it up over a salad, which is delicious!   Basically - this place is super fun. Doesn't take itself too seriously, and even though it's not super fancy, it's awesome food with pretty gourmet flavors IMO.

fBP8XFF3fqFQSEmo5EP0Wg.text: First off, I think it's awesome that Short Leash has gone from a food truck to the downtown location and recently opened a location at the Biltmore. I love to see local businesses thrive in our city!  The location downtown is super chic, hip and a place where you want to have a beer and hot dog. Don't forget a side of that fantastic creamy mac and cheese... YUM!  I ordered the Chicago dog without sweet relish and add spicy pickles. My husband ordered the Lady and my stepdaughter ordered the kids corn dogs. Unfortunately, my Chicago dog came out with sweet relish and without spicy pickles. The server did a great job with exchanging out my dog for what I ordered, was apologetic, and was friendly about the situation. My husband hates sweet pickles, which comes on the Lady, but he didn't ask to change his order. Much to his surprise, he loves the dog exactly how it was made and was glad he didn't alter it. The kids corn dogs were good and what you would exact. Overall, great customer service and good dogs.  Here are the reasons my review was broughtdown from 5 to 4 stars include:  While the servers were very friendly and when I asked for something they provided it, it seemed one more person would have been helpful. There was only one person taking orders and one person checking on the tables. Because there were only two people in the dinning room, when someone would sit down at the table, they were asked to either order at the podium or bar. I would like to see the order being taken right away. Our order took a little longer than anticipated as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side of mac and cheese and the Chicago dog
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer menu
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prescott Brewing Company Amber and iced tea

6n2zgOB-AUMH8nT3lxXr7Q.text: I realize they just opened, however, 25 minutes sitting at the bar with no service is unacceptable. In fact, a woman finishing her meal had to flag down bartender to notice I was sitting there. Then, well, nothing. Several other seats got filled and served...eventually...after 25 minutes I decided to go have tacos instead. Worst service, and they looked like they all just woke up.  Note: sign on door in bar says "WURST STAFF ONLY"  well you got that right! 5*

TSlGhs7dLoiP3MiG_1SrZw.text: I met short leash at the Phoenix Public Market maybe Circle Records was still an establishment across the street. They invented the Carnie for me. I have since had a Bentley and he his also gone, he was a cinnamon Chow Setter mix. I've yet to try a Carnie, but would like to. The Bentley s/b equally amazing. Love you folks, and knew you would still be. Fresh,  good, innovative,  original, simple.

kwUylQMA5xgsBp99adhXdw.text: The selection of beer is vast and very reasonably priced. Good place to eat over all. Customer Service was questionable, even though they were not busy.

xgNI0-RkbrKRFMthL1FsEg.text: Yum the vegan hot dog was a fabulous treat from a food truck! The fried pickles were the best I have tasted!

tIk2c7S8-7aLhlyG8OwXDw.text: Everytime I come here I affirm what I already know, simply the best damn hotdog join in phx!!! Such great taste combos keep my buds entertained even after the 12th time this year

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oMQo45NuQNPEqJdud3O0Ng.text: Love this place? I've been a couple times now. First time I went with a few friends after brunch at Matt's Big Breakfast right down the street. We initially walked in just to take a look at what they had while we were waiting and decided, upon seeing the display, that we would be back for desserts.  We split a few donuts - bourbon cream, peanut butter chocolate, and coffee donut. They were all so delicious, reasonably priced for fancy donuts. And the place itself has a great vibe, very chill and laid back. We even played a round of Uno while we ate.  The next time, I got a maple bacon donut and it was just as tasty as the other ones I had had. I must have been hungry, because I also ordered a hotdog and a scoop of banana and dark chocolate gelato. Got a can of beer too because it was happy hour. Already looking forward to my next time back!

C7OiYSEybkE67Ib4s4ZHEQ.text: I've been a fan of Short Leash Hot Dogs ever since I found there food truck in alley off Camelback & Central, I'm not even someone who likes hot dogs, but these guys, man they made some great dogs!  I won't even lie when I do make it to Short Leash it's because I already know what I want. My favorite starters are the fried pickles, beer battered & deep fried slices of deliciousness and some of the best jalapeno poppers I have had in a long time, fresh jalapenos stuffed with smoked gouda and pimento cheese, battered and fried, Oh sweet lawd! These are some great tasting poppers!    My top 2 favorite hot dogs are The Bear and The Moki, both all beef dogs and on naan bread. The Bear has peanut butter, smoked gouda, bacon, bbq sauce and cracker jacks and the Moki has roasted green chili, sauteed onions, tomatoes, pinto beans, chedder cheese and some mayo. I'm sure if you are reading that you're thinking um no, but no really give it a try! Both of these dogs are amazing! The Bear is my favorite and The Moki to me like a fancy chili dog.  If you haven't been to Short Leash, you should stop by and give them try!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Bear
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac Daddy
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jalapeno Poppers - fresh jalapenos stuffed with gouda &amp; pimento cheese battered &amp; fried

qGVx-CZi4UBgqCUUCNv7LQ.text: I really like the Moki, it is what I order every time.  The green chile could be hotter, but that is a preference.  The best part is the naan the hotdog comes on.  Also I like that you can pick the type of dog, chicken, beer, hot etc.

cuw3w2_BmQjuFpJtK7kgKQ.text: YASSSS. These doughnuts are exactly what your Monday morning needs... or really any morning to be honest! My husband and I tried three different doughnuts- coffee cake with coffee cream filling, maple bacon, and plain vanilla with sprinkles. All of the doughnuts were very soft, but retained their full and thick shape while eating. The coffee cake one was topped with coffee cake crumbles and icing. The toppings gave it the coffee cake crunch feeling, but with a soft and doughy touch. The filling was just perfect. It tasted like a coffee with a little cream in it, so it was just what I expected! The maple bacon one was so flavorful! I loved the flavor mix of sweet and salty. It also has the texture mix of fluffy and crispy, so all of your senses are intrigued. Finally, the plain vanilla with sprinkles was far from plain! The icing was just dripping off the doughnut and would melt in your mouth to give you that *drooling while smiling* sensation.  Atmosphere is similar to any diner- metal and wood chairs with metal tables. The outside seating area is a great spot for your morning coffee and to just relax before starting your day. The staff is friendly and welcoming too! I highly recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee cake with coffee cream filling on the left, maple bacon on the right.
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plain vanilla with sprinkles

h6kgCzKhW-n6wlotlqjD_Q.text: The "buns" are weird and the toppings seem like cheap lower quality stuff you buy at a grocery store. The inside is nice enough but the air conditioner was broken and the temperature outside was 110+ and the inside temp in the restaurant was 94. It was extremely uncomfortable. The prices are too high for the quality and the discomfort.

iNz-Q4FU4hOqAWuq8VtiOg.text: Legitly, one of my favorite places for coffee!  Though the donuts are denser as a raised donut, the flavor combinations are wild. I'm obsessed with their Iced Rose Cognac Latte and come back almost every week and the great service from the gals working the registers is too inviting not to come back.  I love the living room space and work in there for hours, it's perfectly air conditioned and quiet. Definitely an under appreciated space, but I'm okay with that if it means I get it all to myself! /evillaughhere

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu 2015
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 80 square feet -- I love all of this!
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Large Orange Cardamom Iced Latté

jtWtO2i7gIM1tfi9Xvj5Hg.text: I travel a lot for work and this is one of the few places I visited twice. This place was cool, fun, and had some masterminds in the back. The dogs were amazing. I had the bear and the Aiko with bacon added. Didn't get a chance to try the donuts, but will definitely come back if I'm ever in Arizona.

KJJHnGFgKQFEhtPU0iAy4A.text: Let's be honest.  If you hate donuts, we can't be friends.  Of all the food holidays we celebrate in this great United States of America, arguably the one we celebrate more enthusiastically than any other is National Donut Day (or doughnut depending on your preference).  I mean c'mon, donuts are basically perfect.  Sweet, savory, soft, warm, decadent deliciousness.  Its our greatest excuse for having dessert at breakfast time (or anytime for that matter).  The creators of Short Leash Hot Dogs had been experimenting with donuts for awhile, but it's only been recently that they've decided to take their donut concept to a stand-alone operation.  In addition to a food truck, Rollover has opened a small full time stand right next door to Oven & Vine on Vernon Street just west of Central Avenue.  With that, I made my way here on Donut Day Friday.  The menu was pretty much as advertised on their website as they had about a dozen different types of donuts to choose from.  I wanted to try them all, but in the interest of my cholesterol I kept it at just a half dozen this time around (though I got an extra for free for donut day).  I got a couple of strawberry glazed, a couple of the coffee cake donuts, a cinnamon and sugar, an orange glaze with pistachios, and the Bear as my free donut (a peanut butter filled donut topped with gouda, crackerjacks, bacon, and a hint of BBQ sauce).  Total price for the donuts including tax came to about $12.  A little pricey, but then again these donuts are a bit more artisan than your run of the mill donuts.    The verdict?  Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes, yes, and yes (use your own When Harry Met Sally sound effects here).  Everyone of the donuts was warm and fresh and had a very liberal amount of glaze.  I've had the Bear before at Short Leash Hot Dogs for dessert so I knew that one was awesome.  Maybe I'm old fashioned but after trying each, my favorites were the most simple offerings I got.  The strawberry glaze and the cinnamon and sugar ones.  Just the right amount of sweetness and portion to enjoy blissfully.  The Coffee Cakes were probably my least favorite (I don't drink coffee so the coffee custard was a little different), but they were still quite delicious.  Next time I'm here I'll probably give the Maple Bacon and Chocolate Chip donuts a whirl.  A quick tip if you're coming here.  If possible, walk or ride your bike here instead of driving.  Parking is a little scarce and it seems like the businesses nearby restrict their lots to their own patrons only.  As a result, your only option is the street and the overflow from the Tapestry condos makes that challenging.  Lots of places around to park your bike though.  Overall a cool little spot.  Much like Short Leash, Rollover keeps the physical scale of their operation small, but with a menu full of tasty options to select from.  Whether its National Donut Day or a regular workday, you're bound to find a donut you'll like at Rollover.  Now excuse me while I rollover from my donut coma.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just a few Rollover&#39;s delicious offerings

7nHIwuIt2e_h0ag-L3fYOg.text: Now you may think you're not a hot dog person, but think twice. This place will convert just about any uninterested non-hot dog eating human. Who knew hot dogs cud be as creative & gourmet as this?  And like are you kidding me!  "The Bear" has peanut butter, cracker jacks, bbq sauce & gouda. How could this possibly be as delicious as my taste buds are telling me?!  You gotta check this place out!  Creative genius.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sittin at da bar and it is Hot HOT out.  Thank god for Short Leash and thank god for air conditioning.

panVJkw3ZnR77rFfbFLGPA.text: I love the food. I love the decor.  I don't love the careless employees who let us wait for almost an hour for our to-go food.  Cold food, cold fries, cold hearted.  Guess I'll stick to the food truck, lest I spend another entire lunch hour waiting on food that is ready behind a counter.

5jbF_ViOX1jsnrhuZGwoxg.text: Awesome donuts. Stopped by this am, to break my 14-hour overnight fast, and picked an old fashioned and a triple chocolate. Both cake. Wouldn't call them massive in size, but substantial and weighty.  The old fashion was dense, tender, wonderful mouthfeel and texture, and the white creme into which the top was dipped was a heavenly, creamy, gooey coating. A meal in itself, and I can usually eat several standard donuts at a sitting.  It took a couple hours to feel ready to eat the triple chocolate. Dense yet. Tender, chocolate-ish cake, rich chocolate frosting, and garnished in mini chocolate chips. Another great tasting donut!  Both are calorie bombs, and both carry the richness of the cooking oil. A single donut seems to be completely filling, both from the stomach and mouth points of view, making them unlike any donuts I've ever had. Maybe these are like donuts that my mythical home-made-donut-making grandma would have made!!!  These are awesome donuts, well worth eating. However, they come at a significant cost delta over plain-old Dunkin' Donuts type donuts. The pair cost $4.84 including any taxes. That's a lot of money for what until now I'd considered to not be worth that kind of money. After considering that, perhaps it's time I contemplate that $2.42 for a morning meal isn't a bad thing, rather than thinking of these as "just" donuts. There is no comparison when it comes to taste and mouthfeel.

c54zY4CPJRWCixUiZy3e4w.text: Don't be confused by the fact that they sell hot dogs... They sell hot dogs with generous gourmet toppings in very large pita bread. So for eight or nine dollars, you get quite a bit of food. Their donuts are also surprisingly good, as they are baked and not fried, and have amazing flavor.  We will be back!

v0ECiA8yauDgvdCxclA2vw.text: Food was OK, but service was horrible. Counter staff obviously could not have cared any less about order accuracy or customer satisfaction. Would bot recommend this place.

OVOvAHihx4Xq7UZCY3moAw.text: I think this place is a hit or miss. When you look at the reviews, its usually really high or really low.   First look, decor is really trendy. From all the little trinkets on the shelf to art on the wall. Loved it. Service was great too.  What this place loses stars for is the food. I came in with a big group and we ordered a lot of different things. I tried several of the appetizers including fried pickles, jalapeno poppers, and a pretzel. All good but not great.  I had the moki for the main course. It was kind of messy and tasted on the average side. It didn't really stand out... I would not order it again.  They do have a great selection of beer and on Tuesdays they are only $2. Definitely would recommend trying this place, but I'm not a huge fan.

Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moki with no cheese
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Devil dog

AG_dnc5jvwAwqC8woJbpcA.text: I little too hip for me. Unique hot dog Choices and the quality seemed good. My basic dog was $9 plus $3 for a handful of fries. They don't sell Coke or Pepsi products. Full bar but if you prefer soda you are out of luck. I had to settle for water. They are too cool for soda I guess. I won't be back but if you are a hipster this place might work for you.

JXNMdLil7TACi38xvtHwvw.text: Stopped by early while checking out the graffiti walls in the area.  Decided on the following Doughnuts: Chocolate chip cookie dough  Peanut butter pretzel Everything bagel stuffed with veggie cream cheese.  All of it was amazing! Plus the great service and it was an all around awesome visit.

nKOdW7jKT9BxKKnX4R5U6A.text: Great food and drink selection. Very cool atmosphere and love playing Uno there.   The pretzel dog and the one with green chilies were amazing.  If you like fried pickles, try them.  They are sweater than ones you probably have had in the past due to the Frosted Flake coating.

-k8isEiL_xvdD7hOy5yqpA.text: My best friend had a Short Leash truck at her wedding and although the hotdogs were a hit with everyone, I was too busy making sure everything was going well so I unfortunately didn't really get to savor my hotdog. Well my husband and I returned this weekend and were not disappointed. I ordered the Devil Dog and my husband ordered the Moki, both with the bratwurst. Both are delicious and super filling. Our picky 4-yr-old had a regular beef dog with ketchup and nearly finished the entire thing, which left me with my mouth wide open. She never finishes her food!   We also had the loaded fried with grated cheese, green chile and sour cream. I probably could have gone without them. The cheese wasn't melted enough and there wasn't enough sour cream on there for them to feel or taste "loaded." The green Chile is also not spicy as I'm used to having it.  Wished we would have tried the doughnuts but we were just too stuffed after our meal. Maybe next time!

MMhTvm5o5IazZZIuo8Uc6A.text: Of course it was awesome as usual. Naan bread makes it .....but I had asked sauerkraut on side so that by the time I got home not even a mile away they had put it on and I had a soggy mess. Had to throw away the naan ....ugh

UuxTYHNT_vqiaG92FQRrig.text: Short Leash has been through a lot of changes and renovations over the last 4+ years, but it has remained a mainstay in my rotation of downtown Phoenix eateries.   The menu is short but sweet, giving you unique combinations to top your choice of dog. The Bear can't be more praised--where else do you find cracker jacks and peanut butter AND bacon on a hot dog? If this isn't up your alley, other options include mac & cheese or seasonal fruits. There are dozens of combinations between your choice of frank, bread, and menu or build-your-own toppings.   Local beers also reign supreme here. The drafts encompass a wide range of brew types, and the fridge is always full of cans.   Finally, the donuts tempt you with a two-shelf selection at the end of the bar. Take one to go so you can have a bit of Short Leash wherever you head next.

bI_kQpE6H7vytECYM_4HhA.text: I love love love Shortleash hot dogs. The hot dogs are big and they will fill you up. The most wonderful thing about Shortleash is that you can replace every hot dog option with a vegetarian option! Completely veggie friendly.   The prices aren't bad and last time I was there they had $2 beer specials. Any kind of beer you could want, they have. It's super casual with a laid back vibe. One of my fave casual restaurants in downtown Phoenix. Plus the patio is pet friendly! I highly recommend this place!

pQz8dug25cwBM57ZP_zZQw.text: A few years ago this place was Harley's, a couple months ago this place was wineburger and right now it's shortleash. Based on the food I have had on my two visits here in a year it will probably be something else. Like if your going to specialize in a certain types of food why not be exceptional??? Both the brat and all beef hot dog I had here where hot hot garbage. How does the quality of your food go down hill when you transition from a food truck??? The service was good which is the only thing bringing this place to three stars. Otherwise it would be one star. Get your crap together shortleash or get gone. We don't need another crap restaurant in the area.

JgYZyyJRN-WLFcLn0rsOZg.text: I tried this place for the first time Saturday evening. It was my first time and I had no idea what to expect. It was clean and friendly, though very stuffy. I don't think the A.C. was working properly. I ordered the green tomato stack salad. It was ok, but not as much salad as I expected and I think the tomatoes could have been cooked a bit more. This place seems like a cross between fine dining and fast food...i couldn't quite figure it out. I think I'll try it again now that i know what to expect. All on all, I was neither disappointed nor impressed.

xkJiPR5fOm_4hjIqJOfJlQ.text: We stopped in for coffee and a donut before a conference we were in town for. I'm a donut connoisseur and I must say the apple fritter and maple/bacon donuts were incredible. I had to use all of my self control not to order 10 more!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uN8SfHkhjq4mY8nkHRXSUA.text: Really cool store in a really cool area. There are games and a cool seating area. Doughnut was tasty. Selection was limited they probably only had like 30 doughnuts total. Also a little bit pricy, $2.50 or so.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BgYt1r5r04IboYel6yMPuw.text: Nashville has no good donut shoppes so when I travel I always seek out local places to get my fix. After much research, we decided on Rollover and we're not disappointed.   The donuts are large, fresh, beautiful and full of flavor. I had the Thai Spicy donut and cognac rose latte. Amazing flavors. Others got the strawberry donut and the caramel bacon donut, both were amazing as well!  Go there and get your fill on creative donuts and coffee!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Donuts!!
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai Spicy donut filled with coconut filling. Cognac Rose latte. Delicious!
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy fresh donuts.

0XwPLdG7oBxz7atRjBDl0g.text: One of my favorite places to get a dog, they are quick and not to bad in price.  Their truck is actually a small trailer and they have have bottled soda in a bucket of ice.  My favorite that I order all the time is the  Bratwurst Moki. The Bratwurst is placed on a pita flat bread and topped off with the Moki concoction that includes roasted green chilis, sauteed onions, tomatoes, pinto beans and cheese. The combination is perfect and a treat to eat.  No frills and a good amount of food.  Will come back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bratwurst with Moki

Drk9d1xnTJz9gxiC9rnuBw.text: So happy that they moved to this location! Service is always friendly and fantastic. I take people from out of town to this place and they miss it when they go back home. They have inventive ingredients, but give it a try! I've never been let down. Try the Moki which is my absolute favorite. They also have vegetarian options, so nearly everyone can find something great on the menu. They have a great selection of beer and cocktails which is always a huge plus for myself.

axa45yRCGbZYqTvS5Eo17w.text: Extremely overpriced for the mediocre food that you are served.  I have had much better hotdogs at half the price.  I'm not sure how these guys stay in business.  If you want a better hotdog, go to El Caprichoso Hot Dogs Estilo Sonora at 35th Ave. and Thomas.

YnmCVl7Ah2UZWjGcrXOozQ.text: The hot dogs were okay but I didn't think they were phenomenal.  They are served on house made naan bread which served as an excellent vehicle to hold the dog plus all the toppings without breaking or dissolving.  Wide selection of canned beers.  Good place for kids.

vzGCh7DB0UKf-qIQyrsYfA.text: I must be from an alternate financial world when it comes to prices here.  Some of the best dogs Chicago has to offer are $7 with fries....and downtown in the highest rent districts.  Often times they're less than that.  Here $8 +$3 fries.  A $5 premium?  wtf? At Gene and Judes (Chicago) which happens to have its own wikipedia page and chosen as the best dogs in America, with fries they're $2.69.....and no tipping!  They're still making a profit. Short Leash, PHX is your market.

PAlRtEPp2bnL8-Hk9zVT2g.text: Stumbled upon The Short Leash Food Truck  while we were at Craftateria--which I would describe as a hipster swap meet--this evening.  Waited in line for around 20-30 minutes before it was our turn to order.  The prices are definitely reasonable, I ordered a Bratwurst Moki and my wife ordered a build your own veggie dog with like 10 toppings, I also wanted to sample the Jalapeno And Cheese Corn dog (at $3 I had to) and we had to get an order of fried pickles, and a bottle of Mexican Sprite. For $20 that seemed like a bargain, these food trucks are usually higher priced.  The food was all really good, I think I enjoyed the jalapeno and cheese corn dog the most, very tasty.  The fried pickles were nice and crispy!  Again I was taken back how inexpensive it was.  All in all I say it was worth the wait!!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 20-30 minute wait but it was worth it

7Lhf-p763uVbh24dq4lyFw.text: Sincerely the BEST fried green tomato I have EVER had. This is a must try of a menu of winners.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raspberry Cooler is yummy

t7cec1ZLApYRY5AVc4dB2g.text: Shut the front door!  We tried three different dogs, fried pickles and the fried tomatoes salad.  Holy s$&t they were good.  My favorite was the bratwurst stuffed pretzel but I don't think you can wrong with anything.  The "bear" was crazy original and delicious.

-qNMxtOGuYRBhD-mEFZoDg.text: I waited a month since my last review to return. I realize they were in transition from sit-down service to counter service at the time. That doesn't bother me, but they had nothing displayed to show that they were transitioning, and nobody said anything about it to me when I walked in. I returned last week to see that they've moved the counter that used to be right beside the front door to the wall you face when you walk in. Now, you walk up to the counter (or grab a menu and stand in line), place your order, and pay. You then sit where you want and grab your own water by the patio door. They'll bring your drink and food out to you. They may check on you once, but if you need anything you'll have to ask. Also, the dessert (donuts and other things) are located in a display case beside the front counter.  The food was great as usual! I got a bratwurst and fried pickles with the dragon sauce - so good! I'll definitely continue to recommend this place to others.

HTYHnuEB-i6cygvXGTtk6w.text: Bad coffee (non-flavored. I'm sure the iced vanilla lattes are great.), great donuts. The staff were quick and friendly.

0GeXw92G0PmijXC62r_xxg.text: At first I thought the pepper  was in the bacon,  but my daughter's corn dog tasted super peppery too, so I think it's the beef we had.  We just couldn't  eat it, love the concept though,  and the friendly  staff.

rFNTc1hxpHEmw8mHELOdtQ.text: One of the docs where I work brought these in. I split the maple bacon with someone (because it's giant) and bit into the most delicious effing donuts I've had in ages. It's substantial, too! It's close to my work, so I can imagine the picking these up for the family on occasion for sure.

QQVUfXE4CvEQURtcFWyK0w.text: Was driving down the street today and looked to my right and was like....OMG SHORT LEASH DOGS!!!! I had been wanting to try this place since forever.   IT DID NOT LET DOWN   I created my own, and I wanted to try everything! The staff was super friendly and they served it up quickly with a long line behind me. I can not wait to find them again.

QKdwhFTqbMUotIFuDUw0Gg.text: Friendly staff, contemporary spot, delicious bloody Mary and mouth watering dogs.  What else can i say?  Came in on a Sunday morning, thought i try the crispy breakfast dog, loved it!  The bar had "The walking dead" Marathon on.  They make their bloody Mary with pink sea salt and Okra, i also ordered a side of fried pickles to go.    loved everything about this place, definitely will be back to try the rest of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary with Okra
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy Breakfast Dog

cjwlSm3G1ORaf3YZmFsL6w.text: I ate some macaroni and cheese hot dog and it was very interesting to say the least.  Sure it's loaded with fat, carbs, and who knows what else is in a hotdog, but it sure was delicious.  That said, the hotdog itself wasnt' anything amazingly special, but the dishes they make from it is.  Next time I'm going to try that crispy hot dog and see how that tastes first.  But as for my first impression, I like it and will return.

dfIC9vLelIxCox4b-EZpOg.text: Just what I was looking for: a local success story with great food at a decent price. I came in at about 12:30 on a Friday afternoon. The lunch crowd was light, and I had my choice of seats inside or out. I sat on the patio to enjoy the nice December day. I noticed they are very dog friendly. Several patrons had dogs with them, and one took advantage of the water bowl provided outside.  I ordered the pimiento cheese dip and the all-beef Igby. The pimiento cheese was delicious. It tasted like it was made on site and came with delicious fresh made flat bread. The grease on your fingers should give you an idea of the flavor and health levels of the food.  The Igby comes with cole slaw, bleu cheese and BBQ sauce, served on a pita or possibly naan bread. The cheese was funky enough to prove it didn't come out of a bottle, while not so strong as to overpower the other flavors. Honestly I would have been fine without the dog, which tasted just fine. The bites I got of just slaw, cheese and sauce were mouth-wateringly delicious.  I'm a big enough eater, but this was too much food for me. I was leaving that night and unable to bring a to-go box. I left behind a little less than half the pimiento dip and a handful of the fresh made chips that came with the dog. The chips could have used more salt and/or a dip of their own, but they were well made and good tasting.  Chad's service was friendly throughout the meal, and my total bill was under $20 for the food and a gourmet root beer. It seemed like they had a big selection of canned beer, but I was working and not able to try any. Maybe next time.  I also didn't have room for dessert, although now I'm thinking a strawberry cheesecake donut to go would have been a good idea. I guess I have something to try next time I'm in Phoenix.

mLH1iUU_QrRk-O91KM-nOg.text: One of the best hot dog spots I've found in Phoenix. My boyfriend ordered a crispy dog and I got a Moki and we both were very impressed. Will definitely be returning

Qnw6AZfEdZ5gTnIJvksA5Q.text: Great little donut shop. Stopped in with my fiance to get a few donuts and they were excellent. Can't wait to go back and stuff my face.

bJMndYsLvDzfRdpUJystFw.text: Holy moley, I've been late to this party for awhile! Today, I ordered to go from short leash; my husband and I were trying them out for the first time. Called in my order, ready in 10 mins! Way better than postmates, which would have taken an hour. We ordered a Cubano, the Millie, a side of fried pickles and an order of poutine. The hot dogs were so amazingly delicious, and the spicy dogs delivered a perfect amount of heat. The pickles, both on the cubano and the fried variety, were a delicious blend of sweet, salty and spicy. And the poutine was like salty, cheesy heaven. Definitely cured my "hanger!" Would absolutely try again!

EgzsMMK6t7DHxU1uOYEtCg.text: Being able to sit down and eat a short leash hot dog in their very own restaurant for the first time made the food taste even better. Their building is purple on the outside, so it's hard to miss! Always easy to find parking, we walked right in. I was comfortable, the room is simple, and the sunshine barely coming in felt cozy.  The waiter was a little bit silly; he didn't attend us right away even in a near-empty restaurant, and he forgot to get me my soda pop. He was really sweet, so I didn't really let it get to me.   I only wish that they weren't so expensive. A custom dog is about $9. I still recommend this place! Everyone needs to try a short leash hot dog once in their life, and shame on them if their prices steer them away. Your stomach won't regret it, I promise.   (And make sure to try their traditional soda pop - it's all part of the experience!)

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soda pop and their dogs with a side of salad. Their chips are just as good!

fVQ6_lnPrSbtZDj1ct3ujg.text: I've had several different doughnuts they offer......something always seems to be missing. Like, they should taste better for the types of options they have. I should not be underwhelmed by a bacon doughnut. That is just not normal. OK coffee, meh service.

jlmJI9ggpDZI25rI_iUuOA.text: Verdict: unless you're allergic to hot dogs, eat here.   Ambience:  modern, a little minimalist, and a nice vibe. Small bar on one side with somewhat limited seating.   Service:  Emily was great, friendly without being overly so. Good attentiveness, and she convinced me to try the Bear dog.   The bear dog starts out sounding right (hot dog and bacon), but then adds funky stuff:  peanut butter, peanuts, cracker jacks (!)...wrapped in naan instead of a bun?    Trust her and trust me, get past the menu print and try it. It's kind if like a Thai peanut sauce on your jalapeno dog, the bacon provides a nice burst, and the naan cuts the flavor nicely. Nothing is overbearing, the presentation is good, and although a tad expensive for a hot dog, we'll worth it. Hey, we never thought we would pay $4 for one cupcake right?  I had a normal salad and water (it was lunch), but this is one of the best casual restaurants I've visited while in Phoenix. Check it out.

hgaigaY8eIiatTlvWG5mAA.text: Q. What did the Short Leash dog say when asked about the secret to a great hot dog?  A. "Naan of your business!"  These hot dogs are out of this world good. Each one starts with, you guessed it, naan bread, topped with a hot dog, brat or sausage with your choice of any number of creative toppings. You can also get chips or greens on the side.  I stopped by a UYE here last night and was blown away by the crowd. Luckily, we had a table and the service was prompt. I should have tried the special hot dog of the day, but in my hurry, I "settled" for the Bear.   If you haven't heard, the "Bear" is a culinary masterpiece containing peanut butter, cracker jack, gouda, bacon and BBQ sauce. The mix of sweet BBQ and peanuts must be tried. Don't just scarf this one down - savor each bite.   I'll be honest, I liked eating at the restaurant more than the food truck. There is decent seating, you remain unaffected by the elements, and the hot dogs taste better to me. When you're in the area, check out this fantastic spot right around where downtown meets midtown.

oqO0S2YfsZRVLpC19PWUEw.text: I know this is a popular spot.  I know the owners are down to earth, friendly and nice people.  I even like their food even though none of it qualifies for food good for your heart.  In fact, you could even claim that I love their food cause well, I just love hot dogs . . . it's one thing that's hard for me to 100% delete from my diet.  I cheat with hot dogs the way others cheat with their cigarettes.  Sometimes I'll give my husband an excuse, get in my car then drive to get an ever so yummy hot dog.  I'm just kidding, well, almost.    I also love creativity and you have to admit these guys are creative~ infusing all kinds of flavours and combinations to their doggies and tasting all so yum, yum.   Speaking of doggies.  This brings me to the reason of 3 stars.  The night we were there, all Elite Yelpers mind you so I mean, you know, we're going to be writing reviews, we're having a good time, tasting practically everything on the menu, including the fried green tomato salad (which is delectable and you get your veggies in).  Here we were, enjoy ourselves when I looked over at another table and there is a LARGE dog sitting by the table, lapping it up, doing I don't know what and well, this dog was not a seeing dog.  Just a regular, friendly, happy dog. And don't get me wrong, I like dogs . . . just not INSIDE the restaurant of where I'm eating.  I could be wrong but I think having this dog inside the restaurant violated several health code violations.  If having dogs inside restaurants is a new trend I'm NOT aware of and it complies with Photenix health code for restaurants, send me a message and I will update this review.  Otherwise, please keep the doggies on the plate, not inside the restaurant where it will cause me to question the cleanliness of the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried green tomato salad- delish!

05DAbaZfDxgqLtjRx6OMFA.text: One of the best food truck places you will find. Been getting crazy dog for about years and will never go any where else.

CxoTlj5L0nBS4pohNaABaw.text: Nice meal with good service on a Saturday morning. We were the first people in on Saturday and had a nice time.

mT8te_kBEuamXGMe9mJqZw.text: Amazing food, fantastic people. Brad and Kat have a True Arizona gem.  Take quality product (their food) with clear and consistent branding, and run your business with love and genuine smiles--that's the ticket to a successful business.  Not many do that well any more. Short Leash does and we love them for it.

bTY2uT1PaS-npvUUfbxblw.text: It seemed like a nice place.  Phoenix PD was eating there, and that's usually a good sign.  However, we waited 10 minutes to have our drink order taken, at which time we decided to flag down one of the two wait staff who had a whopping two other tables to serve.  We ordered our drinks and meal at the same time since we were 1) already done looking at the menu and 2) on our lunch break.  When the food finally came out, the appetizer we ordered came WITH The meal, the salad I ordered as the side with my hot dog looked suspiciously like potato chips, and all three dishes (two meals and an appetizer) were completely lacking any seasoning (including the chips).  There was no salt or pepper on the table, and given the service to this point, I had no confidence we would get it, so didn't even bother to ask.  I did, however, ask for some ketchup to help with the cardboard-tasting chips problem, and the waitress brought  2 TEASPOONS of ketchup in a dipping container.    The food probably ranks a 3 - original combinations, but the execution was terrible. Service is a 0, therefore, 1 star it is.  I, personally, will not be back.

duQfu6QS46l3zMR1-fXJtg.text: Have to add my fine regards to this little truck.  I had the "Devil Dog" and it was indeed fairly spicy.  And I'm the guy in my group who loves it "so hot my face sweats" so when I say something is fairly spicy, it's not going to be for the faint of tongue.  Good bargain for what you get.  The Naan bread made for a "different" kind of "Hot Dog" for sure.  All the fillings were fresh and added to the overall taste instead of getting overpowered by any one ingredient.  I'll definitely hit this truck again in the future.  Good Job !!!

oJNcFArb4SdeyQKV_irb6g.text: Awesome little stand. It's all outdoor, casual seating so don't expect it to be anything more. I had the Orange pistachio donut and tried the bear. Loved the first one and the second was ok. Can't wait to make it a regular morning stop.

HFqdPHnTjWSVHpJusRACBw.text: I have been frequenting this cart since they first started.  Amazing creative dogs and a great price.  I really appreciate that for a set price you can get as creative as you'd like with your hot dog. The list of toppings is quite impressive and I enjoy that it's local and organic. The flat bread bun is more than filling and a great way to mix things up.   As far as hot dogs go, I feel like Short Leash gives me the most bang for my buck. I try a lot of dog places and they go above and beyond. There is nothing better than filling up on a locally made sausage loaded with just about anything you want for $5.00

P9dEBCQMErFiVl8g3OJhQQ.text: These dogs are really as good as it gets!!!! Love me some Short Leash Dogs!!!

ae6hpirMmkOmZ3xVLUbLcw.text: The BEST!! I crave these hot dogs, especially The Lady. All around outstanding service and food. Go try them!

lv1bGvV0Xisph7k5_sFq-w.text: The bear with a bratwurst, Peanut Butter, Cracker Jacks, smoked Gouda, Bacon and BBQ Sauce is AMAZING.

PgVTEZ9z5Y-k1N3R6nmiAQ.text: I love me some Short Leash!  On Tuesdays I often grab my lunch from here when they're parked in front of Urban Cookies, and today I was able to snag lunch from Short Leash at the Phx Public Market. It was no surprise that out of the 3 or 4 other food trucks parked in the lot, theirs was the only one with a steady line. I love that their ingredients are locally sourced, which means that when I support this local business, I'm essentially supporting all the other local purveyors of tasty foods as well! My favorite menu item is the Lady (chipotle cream cheese, fried pickles and sauteed onions), with a chicken dog and easy on the cream cheese. Another delicious option is the Igby (cole slaw, bbq sauce and blue cheese) with swiss. instead of blue cheese. Since their dogs are served on naan-type flatbread, you're saved from the awful and inevitable split along the bottom that traditional hot dog buns so tragically suffer from. Pure genius! I have yet to branch out from the chicken dog as I'm not a big consumer of pork and beef products, so I can't vouch for any of the other dog options. I did, however, try a bite of a jalapeno-cheese Corn Pup and it sure was awesome! The owners couldn't be nicer, also! Just an all-around lovely food truck that Phoenix is lucky to have.

hEeART7hswnoBsgLiwc5Qg.text: Ordered the Lady with regular pickles instead of fried (gotta keep it gluten free) and a bratwurst. Yummy!! The chipotle cream cheese sauce drizzled over top gives a little kick and the sauteed onions added a little sweet. Delicious!

5ZhGlfBrKPtVwSUgywKlLA.text: Oh, it's so easy to love Short Leash. The staff are super friendly and nice and the dogs are just fantastic. This food truck (and soon to be walk-in restaurant!) serves hot dogs, sausages and brats from Schreiner's, a local place, and they are always delicious. Each unique hot dog I've tried so far - the Oliver and the Aiko - are yummy and fresh. The super soft naan "bun" is great compliment to the dogs. Definitely worth a visit!

UfY4HCI9LKX8C2511UzrvA.text: I must be too old for this place. I wasn't impressed with the loud rock music playing and the service was only so-so. We ordered what the waitress suggested which was fried pickles, the mac daddy & the bratwurst stuffed pretzel. Both dogs were bad and the fried pickles were so sweet they could've been dessert. The small hotdogs were drowned out by the cornucopia of strange ingredients on them.

F5wTPIeyiGmh5lKpJDO8lA.text: Love their dogs! Very interesting combination. A coworker took me there on a Friday while attending a convection. Soooo good.

tf2KcTRNCb33KL82lxh4pw.text: I've ordered everything off the menu in every co nation seemingly possible. It's all so so good. And very affordable.

Vw6vvBpl45Phqy2SrhSX2Q.text: My favorite food truck I've tried in the city! The hot dogs are unique, the people working are nice, and you definitely get enough food for $6. Try the Igby!

UDQVh2Rl70sZ42g2bgXz5w.text: Still going strong.  Just learned they will do 'naked' dogs without the Naan for no carbers or gluten free people.  I could eat a naked Igby every single day. SOOO good.

Q_y99_TztXT91dJTS7_uaQ.text: Absolutely amazing! Brings a whole new dimension to hot dogs. Only the best ingredients and cooked to perfection. I had no idea that a dog this different could be so wonderful - Simply Outstanding

b0xgk_3qoF1Szp4zEXZ0UA.text: Moki (with a beer hot), no mayo, add Sriracha and bacon.  Life changing.

CJ_1OlQPigiguOLiDrHSCw.text: What a cute little place! I've had the good fortune of eating Short Leash Hot Dogs before. Excited I finally have a place to write a review.  + Dedicated parking rocks + Incredible selection of beer + The food (come on!)  Bowing to peer pressure (Thanks Deb. V.) we shared the Fried Green Tomatoes. Battered heaven here, layered with avocado, and sprinkled with a heavenly amount of corn, bacon (BACON) and a blue cheese dressing. (The dressing was lighter than I expected. Don't say no if you're anti blue cheese. I really thought it was a creamy buttermilk or ranch. But no!)  I wanted to lick the plate. Yeah, that good.  Stuffed to the gills (with the beer I just had to have - $3 for craft beer!) I had flipped my menu to the back and selected the "Devil Dog". Ordered without naan (the dogs are served on a hearty size of naan) I was offered a side salad or chips. Spicy and delicious with roasted red peppers, green chiles, sriracha, sauteed onions, cheddar cheese & jalapenos. Happy times. (Even tho I couldn't eat the whole thing! Perfect when re-heated for breakfast.)  The side salad was refreshing. I'd do that again as well.  Deb. V. was trying to kill me. We shared a sweet treat served with ice cream. (I can't find it on their online menu.) Suffice it to say IT WAS GOOD. I was very tempted by the concept of a BEER Float. I'll have to return to try that.  Things I've eaten on other occasions: + The Bear dog + Corn Dog Bites + Jalapeno poppers (Eat any of those and you'll be happy.)  Emily was the bomb helping feed us. Super, super sweet!  Oh! And note: The temperature can be a tad warm inside. The ovens apparently heat this gem of a place up. Just don't show in your birthday suit :)

lAqvM8qpdIY1JsG77SAtdA.text: Save your money and go to costco! We had the Braut pretzel dog, overloaded with sauerkraut, enough for three dogs. Don't get the salad, no dressing, don't get the coleslaw, also no dressing. Just don't go!   Also the fried pickles were burnt, burnt like you hate your job burnt.

-qz8z7c43DQnIyBdyYNSzw.text: Update:   Rollover has gone downhill since converting from Shine and lacks execution.  Most of the donuts are sold out by 9:30AM.  Why not make more, toss a few out that don't sell and make the high margins on the ones that do sell.  Business makes more $ and customers are happier.  Inside seating also smells like a basement.  --------- Doughnuts are OK, nothing special.  They need to label the types so you don't have to ask.  They didn't have a menu so no idea what they serve or prices.  I expect a few bugs because it's new but these are basic expectations.  I'm confident they can turn it around because Short Leash Dogs is fantastic.

NkCllvfbIkEBjgyt0cbb8Q.text: Great place to get a hot dog that isn't boring. Hot dogs come on warm naan bread and you'll be glad a standard bun isn't used. They have a lot of free toppings to choose from and even dogs with clever names for interesting combinations.  Their selection of dogs is diverse and I love the spicy one. If you just want a normal hot dog with ketchup, although it will be tasty you may want to take your simple tastes elsewhere. The free toppings are basically included in the price of your hot dog.  Great place and very friendly owners.

mepA4ml4uIB9T1cdcW0MeA.text: I was hesitant about Rollover since I'd really liked Shine Coffee which was the former resident of this location. Carrying over quite a bit of the wonderfully cheerful and efficient staff, having the same great coffee and tea, and substituting great tasting doughnuts for the great tasting pastries Shine offered works for me.  For the folks complaining about the variety of doughnuts, please take a look at the storefront. It's tiny! How many varieties do you think they can fit on their little counter? As for the people complaining there aren't any doughnuts left later in the day... that would be because their big doughnut business is in the beginning of the day for the breakfast crowd. A couple of doughnuts left over after sitting on the shelf in the display window at the end of the day and they're not fresh? Gee, why could that be?  How about this? Show up early at Rollover, get a doughnut or two (I can personally recommend the chocolate frosted, maple glazed, and maple glazed with bacon), have a big cup of hot or iced coffee or tea, and just relax.  Oh, and as a seasonal (fall) tip, try the pumpkin spice latte with a maple glazed with bacon doughnut. No need to thank me. Just enjoy this perfectly decadent combination.

0yZWQY0xSq5HcyRFU_wzFA.text: I really wanted to like this place. I loved it when it was Shine and was excited to try scratch made doughnuts today but sadly I was left underwhelmed. We came at 9 AM today and there were 4 donuts left that looks like it's been sitting there since they opened. From what I see in from the writing in the window, there should have been a dozen different variety but unfortunately, we only got to pick from the 4 old donuts. The donuts were stale and heavy tasting, nothing to write home about. I really was looking forward to biting into a soft fluffy and melt in your mouth donut but these were very heavy and doughy.  Luckily, the coffee is still decent thus the extra star.

YfMSiTOMi975DlyvUyBsYQ.text: What a fun little place to dine during the First Friday art festival.  We came here about 7ish and they had live music outside on the patio.  We ordered our food quickly and found a seat outside to listen to the couple singing.  We ordered two hot dogs at $8.00 a piece.  Both came on pita bread which was bizarre for me but it worked and both were nice sized.  I ordered the chili dog with their spicy beer hot dog (as opposed to just a regular dog) with no raw onion (just chili and cheese) and my sister ordered "The Lady" (chipotle cream cheese, sauteed onion + fried pickles).  My sister loved her dog.  Mine was good but I wish I would have had the option for a regular bun.  We ordered a side of fried pickles which was a nice sized order for $8.00.  These were very tasty!  Our sodas were $2.50 each and came in a glass bottle.  My sister had a Mexican Coke and I had Leninade (Blood Orange soda).  This is place is definitely worth a try for the vast selection of dogs they have.  Check out their menu to see all of the nifty items to try,

lBtrOF88Ff6iDUOEZNOoeg.text: Yum!!  The best place to grab a dog. Such a variety to choose from. Went there with a big group and everyone was very pleased! Pricy but we'll worth it.

vhWZmZhyRtnpuyGAB2TB0A.text: Good and bad experience here. We arrived at 8pm ordered a pretzel dog to split and several donuts. It was about 45 minutes later that we received our food, and it was lukewarm. Being that we were starving we ate it. I can tell they use good quality products, but it was only a mediocre hot dog. Maybe if it would have been piping hot it would have been a better experience. Their chips, again lukewarm, were greasy, like maybe their oil was too cold. I feel like when there are only 5 other people in the restaurant they could have had our food hot and fresh for that wait.  The redeeming factor was the donuts. Tried the maple bacon and the spicy thai. The maple bacon was very good, but the spicy thai was excellent. Probably the best donut I have ever eaten. So for their donuts I give them a good rating. I will come back and give them another try with their dogs, but for sure will be back for those donuts.

WIabgH5lIqn6ySDAeW98nQ.text: I went to this place a few weeks ago and the food is still on my mind. The hot dogs are excellent and though filling, make you want to go back for more. I will say that it does have a lot of breading - rather than normal buns, they use naan or pretzel buns. It makes for a unique experience and the toppings really fill up the experience. Available on UberEATs as well, I won't lie - I ordered it again the next day. I still want to go back.

XKvwUHIWQOX3RAvbm7wfOQ.text: wow.   chili-mac & cheese hot doge. wow. so delight. such donuts. wow v amaez ice tea.  such wow water bottle v glass so blue wow. wow amaze staff.  Also wow. So taste. So doge. wow so hot doge. very doge. much flavor. very yum.  pls toast the naan tho. wow.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. wow

NIqdPXthU7dG_lv1k8UU9A.text: Loved this place! If you are from NY looking for a Nathan's hotdog, this is not the place. But if you want a great hotdog done with a great wrap or pretzel, this is the place. Prices are very reasonable and food is fantastic! A hotdog is not complete without a beer! A very large selection of beers, including local beers! Met the owner while dining on a Saturday afternoon! Very freindly place! 5 Stars all round and recommend!

y0Sqpu7aL1LzTWlcx3bcGw.text: Short Leash usually has a surcharge for coming to your facility, but as it turned out they were just finishing an event near our church on the day of our gathering, so they came to us with no additional surcharge and the promise of 20 people.  Many of the people attending were physically challenged, so I played waiter and the entire event was well received.  These guys will work with you, and our experience was very good.  The food had good reviews too.

xAAQz4kPcVfgjCyCRNI2iw.text: Food was better then expected. Very tasty stuff. Also great doughnuts. Great food experience. Service absolutely sucked. Terrible waitress. Never checked on us. We ordered iced coffee and she kind of slammed on the table and walked off. I went to the bar for cream and sugar. That's just an example. Never made eye contact, not even while taking our orders. I would like to try it again, but no way will I sit at one of her tables. Great food/worst service around. They lose her and it gets 5 stars. The food was delicious.

IARt_WOP8HP-ju3rnfke6Q.text: I rarely give out 5 star reviews, so the fact I am giving a food truck 5 stars is significant.  Let me start out by saying I cannot recall having eaten a hot dog since age 6.  I haven't wanted to, nor have I caved... even at a ballpark when "everyone else is eating one."  Today DD and I called Short Leash, found out where they were camped out and headed down to Urban Cookies lot to try them out.  My daughter is a hot dog connoisseur.  I mean this literally.  My parents actually started a hot dog cart business in her honor when they lived in PA.  She is very picky when it comes to her dogs.  Today we ordered the kid's dog - plain - and a veggie dog, Moki style with no mayo.  We also ordered two of the cheese corn pups.  DD said the hot dog was delicious and the best dog ever.  She said she loved the flatbread.  Okay, she called it pita... but still.  I wasn't sure what to expect when I bit into my dog, but I finished the whole thing!  Delicious.  The owner came and chatted with me for a bit and recommended the chicken dog for my next visit.  I asked if it had a pork casing and he said no... so I will try it out.  I loved the Moki preparation, though.  I love this place and I hope they offer a franchise to someone in the East Valley so I can get it more often.    Yes, it was THAT good.  Get over to Short Leash ASAP!  They have their locations listed on their website a month ahead of time.  I've printed the month of June out already!  Now if only I can get my dog to be featured...

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kid&#39;s hot dog
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese corn pups
Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moki veggie dog

SrvxPOIZ0xZJA2eLeNgOXw.text: Super plus that it is dog friendly! Great service! Huge Choice of local brewed beers! And food was great! Fun and friendly!

n2fugF8ZF368eiaWE8fxyw.text: I love this place --- right near the Art Museum and the Heard Museum --- makes for a great day out.  The location is hard to find if you are travelling North on Central (Phoenix does some odd things in this neck of the woods) --- need to do a U turn at Virginia or Thomas  Fave = spicy Thai coconut donuts  (amaaazing!) Weekly specials are fun ----  Really --- you can't miss with these  and ... When these donuts are fresh they are unbelievable ---

geggvMIgWf6E4P49HDjTtw.text: I love the hot dogs from the hot dog truck so I had to try out their Short Leash restaurant. And it's amazing!!! The food is still awesome! They even have delicious donuts too. But what sets this place apart from any other place i have ever been to is the fact that even though this place is so busy one of the owners, Brad, still remembers me and makes my experience personal and not just like another customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Short Leash Hotdogs & Rollover Doughnuts - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot dog time

e7Ao612Sj_FZgQp8o_KHAg.text: Well, apparently, these are to die for. I am a diabetic, so I will never know. I had stopped by yesterday to get a little something for the awesome people that work the GI wing of the Phoenix VA. Had to park on the street. (Parking for small cars only) So my wife and I order two dozen, not looking at the prices. The guy moves a bit slow, but eventually, we do get the doughnuts. It didn't look like there was much to choose from, but when the total came up to $53.78, I thought, man, what's the deal with this place ? So, today, the day after, I get a call from one of the nurses that demanded to know where the doughnuts came from. I looked it up, gave her the name, number and address. She said that she saw that I live in Maricopa and told me that she would have driven out here for a doughnut. And I said, "even at two bucks a doughnut"?  You bet ! She said. So you go.

-3_RciMS0oHNMZ8y8zpZJg.text: Fun place. Great dogs! Fried pickles, where have you been all my life? Also, an adorable Rollover Donuts mini counter on-site! Winning!

XOuzZGTHf8Duqtf8VOK0IQ.text: The atmosphere has a cool vibe and the bathrooms are super clean! As for the food, I don't eat piggies but the veggie dog is very good. Oh and don't forget to bring a pic of your dog, puppy, pooch:)

BxUOMhJyFD4E7DG--AaZHg.text: I'd drive to any part of the city to find this food truck.  The food is great (Igby and a corn pup...mmmmmm).  They make you feel like you're a friend when you patronize them.  Shortleash is easily in my top 5 places to eat in the city.

dvX39Xl5TCUCwaZeURIWrQ.text: Visited on a Friday night before a Suns game.  I visited with my wife and my 2 year old son.  Seemed to be quite a few families at the restaurant, yet a shortage of high chairs.  Yet, our two year old was able to reach from a normal chair, we're not that high maintenance anyways- this worked, just not ideal.  The menu is fairly large considering they serve various wieners.  What impressed me the most was the beer selection and the pricing, its AWESOME!  The beer lineup is full of crafts beers locally and beyond.  The prices run $3-$6, but most of the beers are offered for $3 or $4.  There was also a decent amount of wine offerings and some on tap (AZ wine).  The food- the food was great, no complaints.  I had the special, which was a sausage of my choice teamed up with some sirloin to pass as a Philly style dog, good stuff.  My wife had the bratwurst sliders and she had no complaints.    One thing I will note is the service could get slow, not too many servers working, especially on a weekend night.  It is also small, so you might hit a wait.  I say hit the bar, there's about 6-8 spots at the bar.  The atmosphere is modern, moderate volume music and a mixed crowd- couples, families, hipsters and hippies.  Enjoy!

Ui5--z8D_QbsRXNXlryUBA.text: My only complaint about Short Leash is that they don't follow me around town in the food cart, which means I cannot eat delicious hot dog concoctions all day! How unfair is that?!?  Well, Amber... we all know you are a VEGAN, so why do you want to be followed around by a hot dog cart?   Well, Reader... Short Leash has VEGGIE DOGS! That is right... this delicious, convenient, amazing food cart has VEGGIE DOGS!  The bread, however, is not vegan. But that is fine, because they chop up your wiener into little bite sized pieces and load it up with one of the many (50+??) ingredients they have available. And when you don't get it with bread, you get two!  I top my double wiener with pinto beans, sauteed onions, green chilies, jalapenos, and tomatoes. I'm going to come up with a name and have them name one special after me.  Excellent customer service, positive vibe, delicious, high-quality ingredients, and I legally get to say wiener six times in 1 review!  Wiener wiener wiener!

sgd6jr23yvHihxNQFxli4Q.text: I like these dogs because they are more like a sandwich than your typical American Frank.  They are served on a delicious flat bread/pita  "bun" and are filled with all sorts of toppings - not just ketchup and relish- I'm talking beans, cilantro, onions, chipotle, cheese, and peppers.   And yes, they do have a vegetarian one!! Their mock meat looked so real it was eerie - I took a nibble and I couldn't tell if they had accidently given me a real hot dog!  So, I tore off a little chunk and showed it to the hot dog man, "This is a vegetarian one, right?!"  He laughed and said, "Yes.  We actually get that comment quite often."

1_6JeOcDMOYIjhMoiXY_5A.text: Hands down the most interesting hot dog I have ever eaten. Vegetarian dog with some kind of mango? SO GOOD! I wish I could follow them around and always have that kind of tasty option. Little pricey at $7 but not bad. Worth it, for sure.

dLl0rno85AvmqErGrI3-Ew.text: Second time here and miserable experiences both times. Horribly ran business. First time I was there with a large group and hey refused to serve us inside - we could only order on the patio. Problem is, the server was absent, she refused to let people pay as they go, she couldn't figure out each persons tab, and we ended up being delayed almost 30 minutes just waiting for our checks. Mind you, this was a prearranged party, so it wasn't a surprise that 50 of us showed up. Tonight they refused to serve us at all!! Issue with their card machine which is fine, but seriously we waited 15 minutes for it to get figured out and absolutely no accommodations. We had cash and they wouldn't let us purchase a drink while we waited.  All the while everyone else is getting served, two guys at the bar, the people at tables, every person before us, but not us. Get your act together.

WcyMdMzdh6MISuImLw4DZQ.text: I love this place.  My wife got the Mac Daddy, daughter got the Bear, and I got the bratwurst Stuffed Pretzel.  Crazy cool flavor combinations and a foodies dream.  Bring your hipster friends too.  They'll dig the atmosphere.

xk7p9qfpj6ex54AaHBXM0g.text: Believe the hype.  Short Leash Dogs owns!  The first sign that things were about to get very good was when a saw a fork on my dog.  Right off the bat I knew it was going to be messy and that's what I like.  I scanned the menu and opted for the Moki dog.  It began with my choice of dog (regular wiener) and then topped with green chilies, pinto beans, mayo, tomatoes, and onions.  It may be the best dog I have ever had.  It was that good.  All the flavors exploded in my mouth.  Short Leash Dogs has managed to turn a simple American culinary staple into something that is utterly amazing.  My only beef with Short Leash Dogs is they tend to operate on a schedule I cannot sync with because of work.  Today I lucked out when they opened shop for the day at a Whole Foods by my place of work.  Can I really hold that against them?  No, I cannot.  Time to find a new job!

BorrN8uP5uhnZYOYACsKzw.text: Just had lunch here with family after morning at the Childrens Museum. Food was great and service was good as well. Great place to take kids of all ages.

XftzZWOQlZEDwf7IY3BEEw.text: Hyped up hot dog?  I'm traveling from the other side of town...waaaaay East!  I picked up hubby from work to enjoy a nice lunch downtown.  There were about 5 food trucks to choose from.  I came especially for the wieners.  I had the Lady, hubby got the Aiko and my little cutie wanted the Corn Pup (corn dog) with relish on the side.  I prefer dogs with natural casings that lend a crunch to the bite.  Love the chipotle mayo and deep fried pickle topping.  Naan bread to hold the yummy stuff is very clever.  Hubby seemed to enjoy his order.    "This is spicy!  Too much pepper!!!"  as my little guy guzzled water down his mouth.  Just FYI if your kids do not like any heat on their food!    I'll get him a regular hot dog next time.  It is the best hot dog I've had in AZ so far. Now I get what the hype is about!   We will be back to tackle some of the other 50 toppings!

LlnPFM2QBk8XDuwNSmYJUA.text: Short Leash catered our family birthday event. Wow - Fantastic food and fantastic  people! They are professional and very personable! We highly recommend Short Leash for all special events!

-MeZnOiOLbw0bwBk82JVCw.text: Two words: Wow and wow.  "Wow" because of how good it was.  And "wow" simply for the fact that I was wowed by a HOT DOG!  Had the beef hot dog and it was about as perfect as I can imagine such a food being. (If I recall correctly, they source their weiners from the local  Schreiner's Sausages, so certainly there's some credit due there.)  What really made this meal was that is was wrapped in a warm piece of fluffy flatbread. Best. Idea. Ever.  For toppings, I had them add pepperoncinis, bacon, and spicy mustard. Though I began to question this combo not long before sinking my teeth in, it turned out to be an excellent decision, if I do say so.  On a down note (which I didn't dock them for), the bag of chips I added to my order was stale, emanating an unpleasant dank cardboard smell. I don't know how difficult it would be, but they really should consider serving fresh chips. Even if they prepared them beforehand and kept them warm until served, it would probably put their menu over the top.  And finally, appreciated the beverages they offered, which are from smaller bottlers and provide a non-HFCS infused way to wash your food down with. I went with a GuS (Grown-up Soda) "Extra Dry Ginger Ale" which is not too sweet and turned out to be a good complement to my dog.

yMWKnNyGQl7rs4LD9On4Yw.text: My first time at Short Leash Hot Dogs.  So far a great restaurant experience.  The waitresses/bartenders were very attentive and greeted me upon entering... Which is great.   I ordered the Mac Daddy and added the following ingredients: green chilies, bacon, mushrooms, and sauteed onions... It had to be done :).  The cool thing is that they did not gouge and charge for each extra topping.  Which is great because I like crazy combinations.  Oh, I forgot to mention I'm from Chicago.  So, no charge on the extra toppings, really was a plus.   The hot dog which is served in between naan, is fantastic!  Option fries or side salad..I went with side salad, which was great mixed greens (no Iceberg here) and a great balsamic.  To drink I order the Santa Fe  Happy Camper IPA.  It was tasty.  Good job Short Leash, I'll be back. Not to mention it is in the heart of Roosevelt Row, next door to the Nash. Around the corner from Firehouse gallery.  Good times

JSPF5Pc2qZmx3xKF4Lk68A.text: Anyone who knows me knows that I love going to Short Leash. The food is incredible and creative. The owners are genuinely nice people. The new dessert donuts are amazing as my husband gets one each time.

fUUvhNK5dixG8EMpP3qO_g.text: I think heaven might just be short leash hot dogs.  They have been touched by the gods, they have been blessed by the angels.   Try a hot dog, any hot dog.  You won't be disappointed.  You can't go wrong.    It's just...perfection.    That's about all there is to say.  Sure, sometimes there's a wait.  Sometimes it's crowded.  Sure.  All those things.  But can you put a wait time on excellence?  Can you complain about something that will change you fundamentally as a human being?  Can you really be upset about something that will show you what we're truly here on earth to experience?  ...I might be SLIGHTLY exaggerating here.  But believe me, not by much.  If you love hot dogs (and how can you NOT?!), you simply HAVE to eat here.  There is no other option.  Eat. HERE.

SGhPd-XA8X4wZ7OgXBv5ww.text: I absolutely love their hot dog creations. They have very different and unique flavor combination and they are served on naan like flat bread, not the same old hot dog bun.  My personal favs are the Aiko and the Moki. All hot dogs cost $5 which i'm willing to pay for these tasty puppies!

th9XSKgveQRrrRgdakhtkw.text: In town with friends visiting and decided to go to the food truck event today. Saw short leash hot dog truck and decided to try it out. We tried the Aioki dog with mango chutney, the naan bread is a great idea however the dogs were very small for the price. The mango chutney and mayo was not a good combination and the mango chutney was too chunky more like a salsa. Also had a plain hot dog and the dog was crunchy which was a bit odd to me having eaten hot dogs my whole life. The hotdogs would have tasted better just steamed and not grilled afterwards made it too dry. The staff is overall friendly. They gave a free sample of there fried pickles to try and they were okay.

Mhj3wESf5Qw6qvs3b48TmQ.text: Love this place, love the staff, love love the food! My favorite is the Igby.

mAv28yUGEkDFKHh_ITJzUw.text: Really good, quality hot dogs. However, very pricey for a small-ish meal. Also, not a ton of seating, which is kind of a downer. I would go back for a casual meal when I'm downtown.
